One of the team members worked earlier with company A praised their professionalism and quality. Another team member prefers Company B. Other team members join the conversation by adding their opinions. What element should they focus on to select a seller?
Procurement.Explanation: In choosing evaluation criteria, the buyer seeks to ensure that the proposal selected will offer the best quality for the services required. The source selection criteria may include but are not limited to: Capability and capacity; Product cost and life cycle cost; Delivery dates; Technical expertise and approach; Specific relevant experience; Adequacy of the proposed approach and work plan in responding to the SOW; Key staff’s qualifications, availability, and competence; Financial stability of the firm; Management experience; and Suitability of the knowledge transfer program, including training. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 478

Procurement.Question: The customer is very satisfied with the outcome of wind farm construction project delivered by the seller. The customer and the sponsor congratulated the project manager of the performing organization and handed over a letter stating that the contract has been completed successfully. According to the situation mentioned above, what process has the project team just concluded?
Procurement.Explanation: The question states that the buyer has provided a formal written notice to the seller stating that the contract has completed, which means control procurements process has just been completed. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 499

Procurement.Question: Maya is having a meeting with the seller's project manager to check their construction work. In this check, her focus was mainly on the deliverables and the site walkthrough. This is called:
Procurement.Explanation: An inspection is the examination of a work product to determine if it conforms to documented standards. The results of inspections generally include measurements and may be conducted at any level. The results of a single activity can be inspected, or the final product of the project can be inspected. Inspections may be called reviews, peer reviews, audits, or walkthroughs. In some application areas, these terms have narrow and specific meanings. Inspections also are used to verify defect repairs. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 303

Procurement.Question: Contested changes and potential constructive changes are those requested changes where the buyer and seller cannot reach an agreement on compensation for the change or cannot agree that a change has occurred. These contested changes are called claims. Claims administration is a tool for resolving these claims either by amicable settlement or by using an (ADR) if the contract has a clause of it. Such tool may be adopted during:
Procurement.Explanation: Figure 12-6. Control Procurements: Inputs, Tools & Techniques, and Outputs PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 492

Procurement.Question: Your current project is coming to a close. You are highly satisfied with the performance of the vendors and consider some of them for use in future projects. You have delivered the product and received formal acceptance from your customer. You are also finalizing the contractual agreements with your vendors. In addition to these activities, what else might you do as part of this process?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Capture the vendor details and their performance in the project management plan.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Update the procurement documents with vendor details and their performance.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Issue a final report and transfer its contents to the project charter.
Procurement.Choice 4: D) Thank all vendors for the work performed and add incentives to the payment.
Procurement.Explanation: The scenario mentioned that your firm is creating a database that would be used to identify pre-qualified vendors for future use on similar projects. As part of project closure, procurement documents including information on contracts, schedule, scope, quality, and inspection results are cataloged. This information can be used as a basis for evaluating vendors for future projects or creating a database of pre-qualified vendors.

Procurement.Question: During your project, you had contracted with an electrician to perform the electrical work for constructing an office building. You have completed your project ahead of schedule and under budget. You want to close out this procurement. However, you are unsure where you can find the requirements for the formal procurement closure. What should you do?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Review the procurement statement of work.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Consult with the project sponsor.
Procurement.Explanation: Procurement agreement includes terms and conditions, and may incorporate other items that the buyer specifies regarding what the seller is to perform or provide. If the project is outsourcing part of the work, the project manager needs to oversee the contractor’s work to make certain that all the agreements meet the specific needs of the project while adhering to organizational procurement policies. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 109

Procurement.Question: Assume that you are the project manager of a power plant construction project and project's nature requires part of the works to be outsourced to a specialized subcontractor. You want to ensure that the scope of the outsourced works is clear and understandable to all prospective subcontractors. What document should you prepare?
Procurement.Explanation: The statement of work (SOW) for each procurement is developed from the project scope baseline and defines only that portion of the project scope that is to be included within the related contract. The SOW describes the procurement item in sufficient detail to allow prospective sellers to determine if they are capable of providing the products, services, or results. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 477

Procurement.Question: Project stakeholders can be internal or external to the project. Which of the following are examples of stakeholders external to the organization?
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Project Manager - Project Team Members
Procurement.Explanation: Examples of stakeholders include but are not limited to: External stakeholders: Customers, End users, Suppliers, Shareholders Regulatory bodies, and Competitors. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 550

Procurement.Question: The type of contract in which the seller is reimbursed for all allowable costs for performing the contract work and receives a predetermined incentive fee based on achieving certain performance objectives as set forth in the contract is called:
Procurement.Explanation: Cost plus incentive fee (CPIF). The seller is reimbursed for all allowable costs for performing the contract work and receives a predetermined incentive fee based on achieving certain performance objectives as set forth in the contract. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 472

Procurement.Question: The process of managing procurement relationships, monitoring contract performance, and making changes and corrections as appropriate, and closing out contracts is called:
Procurement.Explanation: Control Procurements is the process of managing procurement relationships; monitoring contract performance, and making changes and corrections as appropriate; and closing out contracts. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 492

Procurement.Question: Angel is the project manager of developing a prototype diesel engine project. She needs to purchase 8 servers for her project. The financial department has informed Angel that she needs a unilateral form of contract; as it falls under commodity procurement. Which of the following contract types has been suggested by the financial department?
Procurement.Explanation: Purchase Orders are normally unilateral (signed by one party). They are usually used for simple commodity procurement. PMP Exam Prep 9th edition 2018 – Rita Mulcahy, Page 512

Procurement.Question: Frank is a project manager of a water treatment project who has just completed planning. The Business Unit Head of the company wants Frank to furnish a report that would include procurement delivery method to be used in the project, type, or nature of agreement considered for the project and phases of procurement. Which document should Frank refer to give appropriate information to the Business Unit Head?
Procurement.Explanation: The procurement strategy can also include information on procurement phases. Information may include: Sequencing or phasing of the procurement, a description of each phase and the specific objectives of each phase; Procurement performance indicators and milestones to be used in monitoring; Criteria for moving from phase to phase; Monitoring and evaluation plan for tracking progress; and Process for knowledge transfer for use in subsequent phases. PMBOK guide-6th-edition pages 476

Procurement.Question: The structured review of the work performed by the contractor is called:-
Procurement.Explanation: Inspection is a tool that is used in control procurements process to review the work being performed by the contractor. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 498

Procurement.Question: Tom is a project manager who is currently engaged in planning risk management activities for his project. Assessing overall project risk has been difficult for him; as he is having some troubles in assigning cost impacts to identified risks due to lack of high quality numeric data. As a project manager, what should he do?
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Evaluate on a qualitative basis.
Procurement.Explanation: Post identification, risk needs to be analyzed. Numerically analyzing risk is costly, not possible in all projects. Qualitative analysis of risk helps project team to know the probability and impact of risk which would further help the project team to plan risk responses.

Procurement.Question: Assume that you are the project manager of an oil exploration project that would last for an undefined period of time, and the nature of the works requires a lot of excavation in many types of soils which requires various excavation methods and equipment. After conducting a brainstorming session with your team to identify the work strategy, you agreed on hiring an expert geologist as a consultant. What type of contracts should you use to hire such an expert?
Procurement.Explanation: Time and material contracts (also called time and means) are a hybrid type of contractual arrangement with aspects of both cost-reimbursable and fixed-price contracts. They are often used for staff augmentation, acquisition of experts, and any outside support when a precise statement of work cannot be quickly prescribed. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 472

Procurement.Question: Douglas is managing a store expansion project. During execution and after conducting a bidder conference, a bidder has sent an email requesting some additional data which has not been asked for during the conference. What should Douglas do next?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Send the required data by email to all bidders who have submitted the proposals.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Hold another bidder conference and explain the importance of the point that was missed in the beginning.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Send the change request to the CCB.
Procurement.Choice 4: D) Create a revised Request For Proposal including the new data and send it by email to all bidders.
Procurement.Explanation: It may not be cost-effective to conduct another bidder conference; as many aspects have been already covered in the already held bidding conference. Thus, Option B is not correct. Instead of sending only the required data as mentioned in Option A, it is better to send a revised Request For Proposal in order to ensure that your requirements are well understood.

Procurement.Question: The process of documenting project procurement decisions, specifying the approach, and identifying potential sellers is called:
Procurement.Explanation: Plan Procurement Management is the process of documenting project procurement decisions, specifying the approach, and identifying potential sellers. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 459

Procurement.Question: Bidder conference is one of the tools and techniques that might be used during which of the following processes?
Procurement.Explanation: Figure 12-4. Conduct Procurements: Inputs, Tools & Techniques, and Outputs PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 482

Procurement.Question: You are a project manager of a tower construction project that will be using three cranes. The use of cranes is essential as it's described in the method statement. In which process would you make sure that the cranes are available as planned?
Procurement.Explanation: Control Resources is the process of ensuring that the physical resources assigned and allocated to the project are available as planned, as well as monitoring the planned versus actual utilization of resources and taking corrective action as necessary. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 352.

Procurement.Question: Midway through your project, you received a change request form the seller organization requesting extra costs and extension of time for some works that have been executed as per the client request which were not part of the original scope. After meeting with the seller representative to agree on the compensation amount, you could not reach any agreed figures. What should you do next?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Raise the issue to the CCB.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Follow the alternative dispute resolution procedures in the contract (if applicable).
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Ask the seller organization to seek arbitration.
Procurement.Choice 4: D) Specify the compensation amount you see appropriate.
Procurement.Explanation: Claims are documented, processed, monitored, and managed throughout the contract life cycle, usually in accordance with the terms of the contract. If the parties themselves do not resolve a claim, it may have to be handled in accordance with alternative dispute resolution (ADR) typically following procedures established in the contract. Settlement of all claims and disputes through negotiation is the preferred method. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 498

Procurement.Question: You are managing an IT automation project. Which of the following should you use to compare different subcontractors and rate their proposals?
Procurement.Explanation: In choosing evaluation criteria, the buyer seeks to ensure that the proposal selected will offer the best quality for the services required. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 478

Procurement.Question: A trading company wants to build a new website to meet their growing strategic needs. The company decides to award a contract to a renowned marketing services company for building their new website. The process of implementation of legal agreement for delivery followed by awarding a contract happens as a part of which of the following processes?
Procurement.Explanation: Conduct procurements is the process of obtaining seller responses, selecting a seller, and awarding a contract. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 482

Procurement.Question: Emma is the project manager of a railway construction project and some of the works shall be performed by a special subcontractor and she wants to make sure that the scope of the outsourced work is clearly defined and understood by the performing subcontractor; as she wants to avoid any claims that the subcontractor might raise regarding the limits of the scope of works. If the subcontractor raised any claims that they think they are entitled for, which process should handle these claims?
Procurement.Explanation: Contested changes and potential constructive changes are those requested changes where the buyer and seller cannot reach an agreement on compensation for the change or cannot agree that a change has occurred. These contested changes are called claims. When they cannot be resolved, they become disputes and finally appeals. Claims are documented, processed, monitored, and managed throughout the contract life cycle, usually in accordance with the terms of the contract. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 498

Procurement.Question: You are managing a railway construction project. Your vendor selection took more time than anticipated. Finally, the vendor is onboard now. After 1 month, the vendor informs you that some of his resources have left and he lacks the required team to complete the project. What should you do next?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Make a decision according to the contract.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Ask the vendor to analyze the impact of this on the project.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Cancel the contract and select the second best vendor.
Procurement.Choice 4: D) Ask the vendor to continue the work until they find a replacement.
Procurement.Explanation: The best thing to do is to take the decision according to the contract; as it includes the general terms and conditions, termination clause and alternative dispute resolution mechanisms, and subordinate subcontractor approvals.

Procurement.Question: You are the procurement manager in a class A contractor and you have sent an RFP to several subcontractors for an important project in your company. Some of the subcontractors have sent you some queries and you want to make sure that all subcontractors have a clear understanding regarding the scope of work. What should you do?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Perform Define scope process one more time.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Send the replies to the subcontractors who sent queries.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Conduct a kick off meeting.
Procurement.Explanation: Bidder conferences (also called contractor conferences, vendor conferences, and pre-bid conferences) are meetings between the buyer and prospective sellers prior to proposal submittal. They are used to ensure that all prospective bidders have a clear and common understanding of the procurement and no bidders receive preferential treatment. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 487.

Procurement.Question: Assume that you are working in a buyer organization and you are about to launch a residential project which its requirements are clearly identified. You want to avoid any increase in prices; as the project would last for 1 year. Which of the following contracts types should you suggest using?
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Fixed Price with Economic Price Adjustment (FPEPA)
Procurement.Explanation: Firm fixed price (FFP). The most commonly used contract type is the FFP. It is favored by most buying organizations because the price for goods is set at the outset and not subject to change unless the scope of work changes. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 471

Procurement.Question: Assume that you are the project manager of a multi-store parking project and the firefighting system in the building is very complicated that you decided to outsource it to a specialized seller to avoid any risks. After you have dispatched some RFPs to several sellers, you received a lot of inquiries that show that some sellers have a misunderstanding of the scope of work. What should you do to guarantee the all sellers have the same understanding?
Procurement.Choice 1: A) Send all sellers the answers for all inquiries even if they did not ask any.
Procurement.Choice 2: B) Send each seller the answer to their inquiry only.
Procurement.Choice 3: C) Conduct a kick off meeting for all sellers.
Procurement.Explanation: Bidder conferences (also called contractor conferences, vendor conferences, and pre-bid conferences) are meetings between the buyer and prospective sellers prior to proposal submittal. They are used to ensure that all prospective bidders have a clear and common understanding of the procurement and no bidders receive preferential treatment. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 487

Procurement.Question: If the outsourced deliverables do not match the agreed-upon acceptance criteria, what should the project manager refer to verify this with the contractor?
Procurement.Explanation: Statement of Work includes Description of the procurement item, Specifications, quality requirements and performance metrics, Description of collateral services required, Acceptance methods and criteria, Performance data and other reports required, Quality, Period and place of performance, Currency; payment schedule, and Warranty. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 481

Communication.Question: Assume that you are a project manager of a factory renovation project. You received an email from one of the stakeholders complaining that he did not receive any minutes of meeting for any of the meetings he attended. What should you review first?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains Stakeholder communication requirements, Information to be communicated, including language, format, content, level of detail, person or groups who will receive the information, including information about their needs, requirements, and expectations. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377.

Communication.Question: Valentine is a project manager of a railway construction project and he is currently in the process of monitor and control project work. His project team created a status report and the information included in this report is very critical to many stakeholders who rely on this information in order to take the needed action. What should Valentine do next?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Distribute the report as part of the monitor and control project work process.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Carry out the manage communications process to communicate the report.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Submit a change request to update the communications management plan before communicating the report.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Distribute the report through the monitor communication process.
Communication.Explanation: Work performance reports are circulated to the project stakeholders through this process as defined in the communications management plan. Examples of work performance reports include status reports and progress reports. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 382

Communication.Question: Marcel is a project manager for a construction project. During implementation stage, he found that there is a great opportunity and he decides to transfer the ownership of this opportunity to a third party so that it shares some of the benefits if the opportunity occurs. Therefore, a joint venture was made with another company to catch these benefits and he became responsible for the project as a whole. What will be Marcel's next step?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Auto generated mail response from receivers’ end in push communication states that the message is:-
Communication.Explanation: Acknowledge. Upon receipt of a message, the receiver may signal (acknowledge) receipt of the message, but this does not necessarily mean agreement with or comprehension of the message—merely that it has been received. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 372

Communication.Question: Midway through project implementation, stakeholders lose confidence in project management and want to withdraw. What should the project manager use to maintain and improve relationships with stakeholders?
Communication.Explanation: Interactive communication. Between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information in real time. It employs communications artifacts such as meetings, phone calls, instant messaging, some forms of social media, and videoconferencing. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: Peter is a project manager of a high performance team. Recently, he was informed that the project team is using an unofficial communication platform to communicate among one another at project level. What should he do immediately?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Arrange communication training of the team and terminate the platform.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Ignore the situation; as the project is running smoothly.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Review the stakeholder engagement plan and ensure that the stakeholders are not affected by this unofficial platform.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Review the communication management plan and direct the project team not to use this platform anymore.
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan can include guidelines and templates for project status meetings, project team meetings, e-meetings, and email messages. The use of a project website and project management software can be included if these are to be used in the project. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: A project team member has made a big error by sending a confidential data to a third party by mistake. The project manager is annoyed and he insists on punishing the team member who was responsible for this. What could have prevented this situation?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Reviewing the stakeholder engagement plan.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Reviewing the communications management plan.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Reviewing the resources management plan.
Communication.Explanation: If the question asks (what should have been done), you must refer to plan.

Communication.Question: During a meeting with your client, they informed you that some of the project sensitive data has been leaked to a certain functional manager within your organization and these data are confidential and that functional manager should not have such information. However, you defended yourself by stating that the functional manager needed to know these information; as it's a work necessity. The reasons behind your decision should be stated in:
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Reason for the distribution of that information PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Adam is managing an IT automation project which is about to complete. After sending a follow up report to the stakeholders, some of them comment that some issues, that are not resolved, have been excluded from the report. What should Adam have done to prevent this?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Better controlled the project documents.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Conducted the monitor communication process.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Followed the change control process.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Conducted the monitor stakeholder engagement process.
Communication.Explanation: Monitor Communications is the process of ensuring the information needs of the project and its stakeholders are met. The key benefit of this process is the optimal information flow as defined in the communications management plan and the stakeholder engagement plan. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 388

Communication.Question: The customer asks the project manager to share the latest work performance report in WhatsApp; as he is out for vacation. What should the project manager do next?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Review organization process assets to know policies and procedures.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Discuss the issue with team and senior management.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Immediately share the report to the customer.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Politely refuse to share the report in WhatsApp; as it is unethical.
Communication.Explanation: Here in this scenario, the project manager should first review the organization process assets (OPA) to know the corporate policies and procedures for social media, ethics, and security. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 383

Communication.Question: As an experienced project manager, you are planning out the communications methods to use as a part of stakeholder engagement. The most effective means for communicating and resolving issues with stakeholders is:-
Communication.Explanation: Face-to-face meetings are interactive, and hence are the most effective means for communicating and resolving issues with stakeholders.

Communication.Question: You are the project manager of mega project having a numerous stakeholders. One of them was resisting your project at the beginning, but after several meetings with him, he changed his attitude towards the project and became supportive. Furthermore, he asked to be more involved in the project so, you decided to send him the weekly progress report via email. This kind of communication method is called:
Communication.Explanation: Push communication. Sent or distributed directly to specific recipients who need to receive the information. This ensures that the information is distributed but does not ensure that it actually reached or was understood by the intended audience. Push communications artifacts include letters, memos, reports, emails, faxes, voice mails, blogs, and press releases. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374.

Communication.Question: Your project is falling behind schedule due to some delays in the material deliveries by some vendors. This issue concerned your client; as this project is extremely important to be finished on time. Therefore, the client asked you to change the frequency of sending the progress report to be daily instead of weekly reports. Which document should be updated?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Timeframe and frequency for the distribution of required information and receipt of acknowledgment or response, if applicable. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Having a lessons learned repository is extremely useful for any project manager; as it helps in learning about various approaches to probable problems that might face a project manager during working on his project. One easy way to make lessons learned repository is to have it online on the company's website. Such information is considered:
Communication.Explanation: Pull communication. Used for large complex information sets, or for large audiences, and requires the recipients to access content at their own discretion subject to security procedures. These methods include web portals, intranet sites, e-learning, lessons learned databases, or knowledge repositories. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374.

Communication.Question: You are running a small software project and your team consists of only five members (including you). As work progresses, you discovered that you will be in need of two extra developers. How many communication channels have been added by the addition of the two developers to the team?
Communication.Explanation: To calculate the communication channels: N x (N - 1) / 2 ; N = No. of participants Case 1 (N = 5) --- No of channels = 5 x 4 / 2 = 10 Case 2 (N = 7) --- No of channels = 7 x 6 / 2 = 21 Thus, 11 channels have been added.

Communication.Question: The project manager, John, is currently updating the project with dashboard reports to include the latest data collected from a project process as a way to distribute the most updated information of the project to project team members and stakeholders. What type of communication methods does he use?
Communication.Explanation: Pull communication. Used for large complex information sets, or for large audiences, and requires the recipients to access content at their own discretion subject to security procedures. These methods include web portals, intranet sites, e-learning, lessons learned databases, or knowledge repositories. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: In a break time on your project, Elizabeth met a key stakeholder of the project she is managing. The key stakeholder was surprised that she does not have the information that her project will be canceled because of future changes in the organization plans and that her team members will be releases. What should Elizabeth do?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Hold a meeting with her project team and inform them about what will happen.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Hold a meeting with the project sponsor and discuss this info with him.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Review the communication management plan and validate why she did not get this information through it.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Hold a meeting with the stakeholders and discuss this information openly with them.
Communication.Explanation: Since the project manager does not have the information that her project will be cancelled, she should review the communication management plan; as it contains the information to be communicated and the person or groups who will receive the information.

Communication.Question: Recently, you have joined an ongoing project as the project manager and you noticed that the internal communication system is not efficient enough and needs to be update. Where should you find information about different methods of conveying information across the project's members?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Methods or technologies used to convey the information, such as memos, email, press releases, or social media. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: The document that contains information about the technologies used to convey the information throughout the project and the person responsible for communicating the information is called:
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Person responsible for communicating the information; Methods or technologies used to convey the information, such as memos, email, press releases, or social media. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: A healthcare organization is ready to launch their new vaccine that may save many lives from COVID-19 virus in the market. The CEO of the organization has decided to do the announcement of their new product in organization's upcoming press release to be held next week. Here, Press Release is an example of:-
Communication.Explanation: Push communications artifacts include letters, memos, reports, emails, faxes, voice mails, blogs, and press releases. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: A new stakeholder joins the project team in a complex project. The project sponsor has already informed the project manager that he is important for the project. After meeting with him, the project manager realizes that the new stakeholder should be involved in all status meetings and receive confidential information in association to the project. The project manager adds him in the stakeholder register. What should he do next?
Communication.Choice 3: C) Update Stakeholder Engagement Assessment Matrix.
Communication.Explanation: Communication Management Plan contains plan for information creation, collection, and distribution. It also determines which stakeholder will receive confidential information.

Communication.Question: During the last progress meeting, the chief supervisor was surprised to know of a significant scope change to the upcoming deliverable which would require him to revisit his team schedules; as some of them might be on their annual leaves. Which process was conducted poorly?
Communication.Explanation: Manage Communications is the process of ensuring timely and appropriate collection, creation, distribution, storage, retrieval, management, monitoring, and the ultimate disposition of project information. The key benefit of this process is that it enables an efficient and effective information flow between the project team and the stakeholders. This process is performed throughout the project. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 379

Communication.Question: Linda a project manager of an IT automation project. As a project manager, she has confirmed the formal acceptance of all project deliverables. The report that includes summary of the project performance has been prepared. What needs to be reviewed here to fetch the stakeholders' list with whom this report needs to be shared?
Communication.Explanation: The situation states that the project has entered closing phase and the final report is ready. Final report contains the summary of the project performance which should be shared according to what is stated in the communication management plan. Domain V: Closing Task 4) Prepare and share the final project report according to the communications management plan in order to document and convey project performance and assist in project evaluation. PMI PMP Examination Content Outline – June 2015

Communication.Question: Which of the following tools and techniques might be used during Plan Communication Management process?
Communication.Explanation: Figure 10-2. Plan Communications Management: Inputs, Tools & Techniques, and Outputs PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 366.

Communication.Question: Expert judgment is an example of important tools and techniques used in project management. Expert judgment is a tool and technique used in all of the following processes EXCEPT:
Communication.Explanation: A, C, and D are not correct. In Implement Risk responses process, experts with specialized knowledge are sometimes required to validate or modify risk responses if needed. Expert Judgment is used in Conduct Procurements to evaluate proposals. In Identify Stakeholder process, it is used to ensure that all stakeholders have been identified, listed, and assessed appropriately. By following elimination rule, B is the right answer. Further, Manage Communications is part of the Executing Process Group. Expert judgment is not required while managing communications. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 378

Communication.Question: Assume that you are a project manager in a software development project and you have learned that a new manager is about to join the client project team and will be involved in your project. What should you do first?
Communication.Choice 4: D) Update the requirement traceability matrix.
Communication.Explanation: An effective communications management plan that recognizes the diverse information needs of the project’s stakeholders is developed early in the project life cycle. It should be reviewed regularly and modified when necessary, when the stakeholder community changes or at the start of each new project phase. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 367.

Communication.Question: The project team applied crashing technique to bring the project back on track. The project manager is sharing the latest project information in a meeting with all key stakeholders, who looked anxious at the beginning of the meeting. He is using stop light chart and earned value graph to display the current state and future forecast of the project. Which process is the project manager currently performing?
Communication.Explanation: The situation states that the project manager is showing work performance report in a meeting with stakeholders in the form of presentation. This reflects that the project manager is currently involved in manage communication process. PMBOK guide-6th-edition pages 379-384

Communication.Question: You are managing a project which is terminated in an early stage. You send the final report to the relevant stakeholders. The financial manager is interested in understanding the impact and requests a copy of this report. What should you do?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Review the stakeholder engagement plan and act accordingly.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Check the communication management plan and act accordingly.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Send the report to the financial manager.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Do not send the final report; as the project was early terminated.
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Stakeholder communication requirements; Person or groups who will receive the information, including information about their needs, requirements, and expectations. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Assume that you are the project manager of an oil refinement project. Part of your job description is to send the government environmental agency a monthly report on waste management in your project via email. This type of communication is considered:
Communication.Explanation: Communication activities have many dimensions, including but not limited to: Informal: General communications activities using emails, social media, websites, and informal ad hoc discussions. Official: Annual reports; reports to regulators or government bodies. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 361.

Communication.Question: Your project is heading towards closing and you want to prepare a file that shows the various stages of the project including the lessons learned during the project supported by some graphic and multimedia figures. This file would be presented to a large number of relevant stakeholders so, you decide to upload the file to the company's website. Such type of communication is called:
Communication.Explanation: Pull communication: Used for large complex information sets, or for large audiences, and requires the recipients to access content at their own discretion subject to security procedures. These methods include web portals, intranet sites, e-learning, lessons learned databases, or knowledge repositories. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374.

Communication.Question: Which of the following tools and techniques may be used while performing Plan Communications Management process?
Communication.Explanation: 10.1.2.4 COMMUNICATION MODELS Communication models can represent the communication process in its most basic linear form (sender and receiver), in a more interactive form that encompasses the additional element of feedback (sender, receiver, and feedback), or in a more complex model that incorporates the human elements of the sender(s) or receiver(s) and attempts to show the complexity of any communication that involves people. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 371.

Communication.Question: During planning, the project team is using a technique to assess communication styles and identify the preferred communication method, format, and content for planned communication activities. Which process is being carried out here?
Communication.Explanation: As per the stated scenario, the project team here is applying communications styles assessment technique which is a common interpersonal and team skills technique used during planning communications. A, B, and D are incorrect because the communications styles assessment techniques are not used in these processes. Consequently, among all options provided, C is the best answer. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 375

Communication.Question: Recently, you have joined a new organization as a project manager, and as work progresses, you encountered an issue that needs to be escalated to upper management. Where should you find information about the escalation processes?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Escalation processes. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: You have recently joined an organization, as a project manager who is leading a robotic system, during execution. You want to have information in relation to the glossary of common terminologies being used in the project. What should you review?
Communication.Explanation: Glossary of all common terminologies in relation to the project are recorded in communication management plan. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: The communication method that involves all parties to participate in real time and employs communication artifact such as phone call and videoconferencing is called:
Communication.Explanation: Interactive communication. Between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information in real time. It employs communications artifacts such as meetings, phone calls, instant messaging, some forms of social media, and videoconferencing. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: Thomas has been assigned a project which is midway into execution. He has to take this project due to the non-availability of the current project manager because of some health issues. This is a complex project involving multiple contractors and teams at various geographical locations. Thomas decides to look up the requirements of the types of reports and frequency of sending them. Where would he find this information?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Flow charts of the information flow in the project, workflows with possible sequence of authorization, list of reports, meeting plans, etc. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Vincent is a project manager of a large project which has just moved to the planning phase. The project sponsor is anxious to prepone the project kick-off and start the execution as soon as possible. He also suggests the project manager to skip the communications management plan for now and prepare the same during execution on need basis. How should the project manager respond to the sponsor to support the completion of the communications management plan?
Communication.Choice 1: A) The communication management plan is required as a part of the project management plan.
Communication.Choice 2: B) The communications management plan is required for estimation and work assignment analysis.
Communication.Choice 3: C) The communications management plan assists stakeholder engagement.
Communication.Choice 4: D) The communications management plan is required for the preparation of project report.
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan provides the documented approach to effectively and efficiently engage with the stakeholders by presenting relevant information promptly. Therefore, of the choices provided, option C is the best response the project manager can give to the project sponsor to support the completion of the communications management plan before moving to execution. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: During one of the client's meetings, you have been informed that the planning department head in the client's organization has not received any of the last 3 progress meeting minutes. What should you do?
Communication.Choice 2: B) Add "Poor communication" as a risk.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Review the communication management plan.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Conduct a meeting with the planning department head.
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Stakeholder communication requirements; Information to be communicated, including language, format, content, and level of detail; Person responsible for communicating the information. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Paula is managing a bridge construction project. Ten days after the project disposition, she did not succeed in resolving an issue on her own. She failed to inform the stakeholders and this caused their frustration. In order not to get the stakeholders frustrated, what should Paula have done?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Followed the communication management plan.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Referred to the stakeholder engagement plan.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Referenced the lessons learned repository.
Communication.Explanation: In order not to get the stakeholders frustrated, the project manager should have followed the communication management plan.

Communication.Question: Flavio is a project manager of a railway construction project. He has identified 6 important stakeholders for the project. The number of communication channels on this project is:-
Communication.Explanation: Total number of stakeholders in the project -: 6+1 (Project Manager). No of Communication channels = N(N-1)/2 = 7*6/2=21.

Communication.Question: According to the sample basic sender/receiver communication model, the sequence of steps is:
Communication.Explanation: Sample basic sender/receiver communication model. This model describes communication as a process and consists of two parties, defined as the sender and receiver. This model is concerned with ensuring that the message is delivered, rather than understood. The sequence of steps in a basic communication model is: Encode; Transmit message; Decode. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 371

Communication.Question: Assume that you are the project manager of a software development project which would involve a number of stakeholders with various levels of interest, and you want to determine the needs of each stakeholder regards to the information that must be communicated as well as the format and frequency of the information. Which of the following tools/techniques should assist you?
Communication.Explanation: Analysis of communication requirements determines the information needs of the project stakeholders. These requirements are defined by combining the type and format of information needed with an analysis of the value of that information. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 369

Communication.Question: Richard works on a global project that involves a large number of team members with a budget of $2,500,000. The weekly status meeting in conducted internationally and scheduled to be on Sunday at 11:00 AM and its duration will be 1 hour. All the team members communicate universally using the video conference tools available on each one's zone. What is this communication method called?
Communication.Explanation: Interactive communication. Between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information in real time. It employs communications artifacts such as meetings, phone calls, instant messaging, some forms of social media, and videoconferencing. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: You are in the execution stage in your project. The stakeholders are escalating some issues to management directly without engaging you in these issues. Which of the following would have prevented this if there was a state of well documentation and communication?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Stakeholder communication requirements; Information to be communicated, including language, format, content, and level of detail; Person responsible for communicating the information. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: An infrastructure project is 4 months into execution when a key stakeholder leaves the organization and another person from the same functional department is assigned to the project. The project manager has made the necessary update of all the project documents with the new data. What should the project manager do before the upcoming stakeholders' review meeting?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Send all the project documents to the new stakeholder.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Determine if the planned communications will meet the new stakeholder's needs.
Communication.Choice 3: C) Make the new stakeholder up to date on any unresolved problems in project.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Meet with the new stakeholder to introduce himself with the project team.
Communication.Explanation: As long as he is a new stakeholder and has communication requirements, the project manager should determine if the planned communications will meet the new stakeholder's needs before the upcoming stakeholder's review meeting.

Communication.Question: The main purpose of the kick-off meeting in any projects is to:
Communication.Choice 1: A) Announce the start of the project.
Communication.Choice 2: B) Communicate project objectives, gain team commitment and explain roles & responsibilities.
Communication.Choice 4: D) Review and prioritize individual project risks.
Communication.Explanation: The project kick-off meeting is usually associated with the end of planning and the start of executing. Its purpose is to communicate the objectives of the project, gain the commitment of the team for the project, and explain the roles and responsibilities of each stakeholder. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 86

Communication.Question: The client in your project has reached out for you to ask for a modification in the final product of your project. You want to fully understand the client's requirements so, you decided to conduct a meeting with the client and some subject matter experts. Meeting are considered:
Communication.Explanation: Interactive communication. Between two or more parties performing a multidirectional exchange of information in real time. It employs communications artifacts such as meetings, phone calls, instant messaging, some forms of social media, and videoconferencing. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 374

Communication.Question: The project is getting released soon and the project manager is about to start the closing activities. In the meantime, the project sponsor advised the project manager that few confidential information in relation to the project needs to be shared with all key stakeholders before the start of closure activities. What should the project manager do to know the name of the person or people responsible for authorizing the release of confidential information?
Communication.Choice 1: A) Review project charter to know the name of the responsible person.

Communication.Choice 4: D) Review the communication management plan to know the name of the responsible stakeholders who are authorized to release the confidential information.
Communication.Explanation: Communication management plan states the name of the person responsible for authorizing the release of confidential information. The project manager should review communication management plan to fetch this necessary information. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: Which project documents provides information about timeframe and frequency for the distribution of required information and receipt of acknowledgment or response, if applicable?
Communication.Explanation: The communications management plan is a component of the project management plan that describes how project communications will be planned, structured, implemented, and monitored for effectiveness. The plan contains the following information: Timeframe and frequency for the distribution of required information and receipt of acknowledgment or response, if applicable PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 377

Communication.Question: An analytical technique which is used to determine the type, format of information needed, and communication needs of the project stakeholders is called:
Communication.Explanation: Communication Requirements Analysis. An analytical technique to determine the information needs of the project stakeholders through interviews, workshops, study of lessons learned from previous projects, etc. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 701

Integration.Question: You have just replaced a fellow project manager. After reviewing the project documents, you couldnâ€™t find any project charter, and by speaking with the sponsor you were told that your company executes many projects without using project charters. As a project manager, you should:
Integration.Choice 1: A) Conduct a meeting with the sponsor to discuss the urge of having a project charter.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Establish a project charter and conduct a meeting with your team to explain everyoneâ€™s duties and responsibilities and to clarify the projectâ€™s key deliverables.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Establish a draft of the project charter and raise it to your manager.
Integration.Choice 4: D) Conduct a kick-off meeting and announce project start.
Integration.Explanation: The project charter establishes a partnership between the performing and requesting organizations. In the case of external projects, a formal contract is typically the preferred way to establish an agreement. A project charter may still be used to establish internal agreements within an organization to ensure proper delivery under the contract. The approved project charter formally initiates the project.

Integration.Question: After completing the work in your project, you want to communicate formal project closure and ensure transfer of liability. As a project manager, what should you do?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Obtain final acceptance of the project deliverables.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Transfer the ownership of deliverables to the assigned stakeholders.

Integration.Question: Andrew is a new project manager who has joined the luxury complex construction project during the middle of its execution. He is trying to determine whether the modification of any of the project documents is subject to change request. What needs to be reviewed to obtain this necessary information?
Integration.Explanation: A change request must be submitted to update any baseline or the project management plan. Project documents may or may not be placed under configuration control depending on the standards outlined in the configuration management plan. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 41, 701

Integration.Question: You have just been hired to work in an ongoing project in which the functional managers are responsible for arranging work groups while the project manager is responsible for managing the project budget. What organizational structure type is being used in such a project?
Integration.Explanation: Table 2-1. Influences of Organizational Structures on Projects PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 47

Integration.Question: You have been recently assigned to a project as a project manager. You are involved in creating a document that would formally authorize the project and capture the initial requirements of the stakeholders. Which of the following should you complete in order to conduct a kick-off meeting?
Integration.Explanation: The project kick-off meeting is usually associated with the end of planning and the start of executing. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 86

Integration.Question: You are managing a research and development project for your organization. You requested some of the team members to work on your project, but the functional manager refused to allow his employees to spend time on your project. Which one of the following is LIKELY to be missing from your project in this instance?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Obtain project management plan approval from the sponsor.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Obtain project charter approval from the sponsor.
Integration.Explanation: The project charter is the document issued by the project initiator or sponsor that formally authorizes the existence of a project and provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 81

Integration.Question: In a typical business complex and mid-sized agile project, what does the project team attempt to develop every Sprint?
Integration.Choice 4: D) Source Code ready to be handed off to QC for testing
Integration.Explanation: The output of every Sprint is called a Potentially Releasable Product Increment. It is the sum of the Product Backlog Items completed during a Sprint. Delivering Potentially Releasable Product each Sprint is fundamental to the Scrum; since in agile, as work is divided into simple pieces, it can be finished in a short iteration. In Agile, â€œWorking software is the primary measure of progress. Final working software is produced in last sprint, not in every sprint, as asked in the question. Therefore, option A is ruled out. The product backlog is a living document that has anything and everything in relation to project work. It is the ordered list of all the work presented in story form for a team. It is the single source of requirements for any changes to be made to the product. The Product owner is responsible for the product backlog. Therefore, option C is not correct. Agile development team is a cross-functional team (where developers, testers, QA, QC, etc.) work together to deliver an increment. Thus, option D makes no sense. Agile Practice Guide \- Project Management Institute Inc., 2017, Page 101"

Integration.Question: The explicit application of the influencing skill of the project manager is most applicable in:-
Integration.Explanation: The authority of the project manager is least in weak matrix organization among all specified above. Itâ€™s the proper utilization of influencing skill which the project manager requires for his success in project as a project manager. Further, any matrix organization has two reporting bosses.

Integration.Question: Lucas is managing an underground tunnel project. The project sponsor got some information about the project that is behind schedule and over budget, but he needs more details about the project's progress. What should Lucas provide him to know about the status of the project?
Integration.Explanation: Work performance information is combined, recorded, and distributed in a physical or electronic form in order to create awareness and generate decisions or actions. Examples of work performance reports include status reports and progress reports. Work performance reports can contain earned value graphs and information, trend lines and forecasts, reserve burndown charts, defect histograms, contract performance information, and risk summaries. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 112

Integration.Question: As you were preparing to attend an important meeting, two of your team members came to you with a heated discussion about the way to perform a work task and asked you to decide which way should be implemented. You didn't have time to resolve this problem before the meeting so, you told them to wait till you finish your meeting. The method you used is called:
Integration.Explanation: Withdraw/avoid. Retreating from an actual or potential conflict situation; postponing the issue to be better prepared or to be resolved by others. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 349

Integration.Question: After developing the project charter, who should usually approve it?
Integration.Explanation: Domain I) Initiating Task 6 Obtain project charter approval from the sponsor, in order to formalize the authority assigned to the project manager and gain commitment and acceptance for the project. PMI PMP Examination Content Outline â€“ June 2015

Integration.Question: After the last progress meeting, your client informed you that she would like to add a change to the upcoming deliverable. You analyzed the change and informed the client of the impact and got approved by the sponsor, and now you are in the process of implementing the change on site. Which process are you in?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Direct and Manage Project Work
Integration.Explanation: Direct and Manage Project Work is the process of leading and performing the work defined in the project management plan and implementing approved changes to achieve the projectâ€™s objectives. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 90

Integration.Question: Edward has that skill which makes him a super talented engineer. He has the skill that if someone with no experience got hired within his organization, it would take him many years to catch his skill. This type of knowledge is called:
Integration.Explanation: Tacit Knowledge. Personal knowledge that can be difficult to articulate and share such as beliefs, experience, and insights. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 724

Integration.Question: The CCB has just approved a change request to modify one of the major deliverables. In which process will this change be implemented?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Direct and Manage Project Work
Integration.Choice 3: C) Monitor and Control Project Work
Integration.Explanation: An approved change request for corrective actions, preventive actions, and defect repairs will be implemented in the direct and manage project work process.

Integration.Question: You are managing an infrastructure project and you are trying to create the project communication channels. Currently, you are in the process of issuing change requests and including the approved change requests in the project's scope, plans, and budget. You are also working with a training provider to train your project team to use some new software that are important in your project. What process are you performing?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Direct and Manage Project Work
Integration.Choice 4: D) Monitor and Control Project Work
Integration.Explanation: Although the project manager is developing the team, we can not choose the develop project team process because the project manager is doing multiple activities. All these activities are performed in the direct and managed project work process.

Integration.Question: You are managing a construction project in which the project sponsor asks for delivery in a specific date in order to meet mandatory compliance. If the project fails to be within this time frame, the organization will bear penalty fees. During execution, you identified additional requirements that would delay the delivery by a couple of months. What should you do?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Analyze the impact with the project team to discuss the alternatives with the project sponsor.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Reject the additional requirements and stick to the schedule to deliver on time.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Update the project schedule to include the additional work.
Integration.Choice 4: D) Engage the legal team to document a response to reduce the negative impact on the organization.
Integration.Explanation: The first step to be done is analyzing the impact with the project team to discuss the alternatives with the project sponsor. Option C is not correct; as it is not preferable to update the schedule without having a formal change request approved by the CCB.

Integration.Question: The project charter is the document that formally authorizes the existence of a project and provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. Who usually issues the project charter?
Integration.Explanation: The project charter is the document issued by the project initiator or sponsor that formally authorizes the existence of a project and provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 81

Integration.Question: You are managing a marketing project. Halfway through the implementation phase, it came to your knowledge that a competitor is going to put out the same products into the market. As a project manager, what should you do?
Integration.Choice 3: C) Advise the sponsor to cancel the project.
Integration.Explanation: In this scenario, the project manager should perform a cost-benefit analysis to determine whether he is going to continue or cancel the project.

Integration.Question: Assume that you are a project manager and you are having a phase gate meeting to decide whether to proceed with the following phase or not. Which of the following documents you are most likely to use?
Integration.Explanation: A phase gate, is held at the end of a phase. The projectâ€™s performance and progress are compared to project and business documents including but not limited to Project charter. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 21\.

Integration.Question: You have been promoted to be the project manager of a new project and your current task is to help developing the project charter. Which of the following documents should be an input to this process?
Integration.Explanation: The approved business case, or similar, is the business document most commonly used to create the project charter. The business case describes the necessary information from a business standpoint to determine whether the expected outcomes of the project justify the required investment. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 77\.

Integration.Question: You are an owner of a small start-up technical office. You have been awarded a fixed price project by a governmental organization which you are required to complete in 3 months. The project charter is approved and the key people who were affected by success and failure of the project have been identified. After working with the project team, you have decided to execute the project by using agile approach. What should you do next?
Integration.Choice 4: D) Work with team and build an implementation strategy.
Integration.Explanation: The situation states that a start-up technical office has been awarded a 3-month project which involves Fixed-Price Contract. We can assume that in this case project scope is also well defined, since price and time line are both fixed, and it is the characteristics of selecting a fixed price contract. Also, this is not an example of a large project. At the project level, if the project is small, the kickoff meeting takes place shortly after the initiation process (in the planning process group), and this includes all team members; as the same team is involved with the planning and execution in most possible scenario. Many go for option A, but we should always remember that in most of the cases, implementation strategy is determined before project gets approved. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 86 Domain I Initiating: Task 4\) Identify high level risks, assumptions, and constraints based on the current environment, organizational factors, historical data, and expert judgment, in order to propose an implementation strategy. PMI PMP Examination Content Outline â€“ June 2015

Integration.Question: Your company has assigned you to manage a university extension project due to your previous experience. A clause in the signed contract between the two parties states that All works must be completed and handed over before the 1st of September". Such a clause is considered a:"
Integration.Explanation: A risk is an event that may or may not happen, resulting in unwanted consequences or losses. A constraint is a real-world limit on the possibilities for your project. You need to manage both carefully. https://www.projectmanagement.com/presentations/193607/Risks-and-Constraints

Integration.Question: Which of the following processes is concerned with managing changes to deliverables throughout the project?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Monitor and Control Project Work
Integration.Choice 3: C) Direct and Manage Project Work
Integration.Explanation: Perform Integrated Change Control is the process of reviewing all change requests; approving changes and managing changes to deliverables, organizational process assets, project documents, and the project management plan; and communicating the decisions. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 70

Integration.Question: Which of the following is considered a main output to the Close Project or Phase process?
Integration.Explanation: Figure 4-14. Close Project or Phase: Inputs, Tools & Techniques, and Outputs PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 121

Integration.Question: An infrastructure project is near its closure. The project manager is now carrying out all of the activities associated with project closure. Which of the following activities should the project manager and team perform as a part of the process?
Integration.Choice 2: B) Update all the project documents and mark them as final version.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Ask the customer for a letter recommending that the contract can be closed.
Integration.Choice 4: D) Update organizational process asset to include the final version of pre-approved sellers list and seller performance evaluation documentation.
Integration.Explanation: During closing, all project documents may be updated and marked as final versions as a result of project closure. The question here asks about tasks associated to closing activities. C and D are both associated with control procurements process, and A is not a valid choice. Some may get confused between B and D, but we need to remember that OPAâ€™s are updated for both control procurements and close project or phase process. Thus, among all options provided B is the best answer. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 127

Integration.Question: During the middle of a tower construction project that is using Agile-scrum methodology, the scrum master leaves the company. This was documented as a risk during the initiation phase of the project. What corrective action needs to be taken care in the situation mentioned above?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Examine the assumption log and take appropriate action.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Ask the product owner to play dual role.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Ask the senior most team member to play the role of scrum master.
Integration.Choice 4: D) Review the project charter and work with the functional manager to resolve the issue.
Integration.Explanation: Project Charter also captures the overall project risks at high level. Since the question states that the exit of the Scrum Master has already been documented as risk during Initiation so, itâ€™s obvious that the project manager or any related responsible authority should consult the project charter, risk response plan developed to handle the stated risk, and then work with the functional manager to execute necessary steps involved in resolving the issue. Options A and B are not correct; as role changes or implementation of dual roles are not examples of best practices. Option C is also ruled out; as it will not provide any solution. Among all options, option D is the best choice.

Integration.Question: During the development stage of a software development project, the client refuses to give the project team access to their database. As the database is essential for setting up the application, this could impact the project deliverables. As a project manager, what should you do next?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Log it in the risk register.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Update the issue log and meet with the client to review.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Review the project statement of work (SOW).
Integration.Choice 4: D) Discuss it with the project team and update the project schedule.
Integration.Explanation: As the client refuses to give access to the database, this is considered an issue and the project manager should first update the issue log and meet with the client to review and solve it.

Integration.Question: Which of the following statements BEST describes the responsibility of the project sponsor?
Integration.Choice 1: A) The project sponsor is responsible for identifying key stakeholders.
Integration.Choice 2: B) The project sponsor is responsible for managing the project.
Integration.Choice 3: C) The project sponsor is responsible for providing funds for the projects.
Integration.Choice 4: D) The project sponsor is responsible for managing the quality of deliverables.
Integration.Explanation: Although the project sponsor can help in identifying the key stakeholders, the main role of the project sponsor is providing funds. He provides funding directly and indirectly and is responsible for approving or denying the budget.

Integration.Question: After final acceptance of deliverables by the customer, the project manager and the team have prepared a report that contains summary of project performance from scope, quality, cost, and schedule point of view. The report also includes summary of risks or issues encountered in the project and how they were addressed. After reviewing the report with the project sponsor, the project manager decides to share the same to all stakeholders who are authorized to receive the report. What report has been prepared by the project manager and the team?
Integration.Explanation: The question states that the project team is doing closing activities and they have prepared the final report to measure project success and stakeholder satisfaction. Many people may answer this as work performance report, which is not correct. Work performance reports are the physical or electronic representation of work performance information intended to generate decisions, actions, or awareness. Examples include progress report, status report, etc. Above all, Work performance report is not an input or output for closing. From all options provided, A is the best answer. PMBOK guide-6th-edition pages 127, 128

Integration.Question: Lessons learned from previous projects and historical information are included in which of the following inputs to the Develop Project Charter process?
Integration.Explanation: OPAs include any artifact, practice, or knowledge from any or all of the performing organizations involved in the project that can be used to execute or govern the project. The OPAs also include the organizationâ€™s lessons learned from previous projects and historical information. PMBOK guide-6th-edition page 39

Integration.Question: You received a phone call from your client asking to add a feature in the next deliverable that he thinks will have no impact on the project schedule or cost. As a project manager, what is the first thing you should do?
Integration.Choice 1: A) Hold a meeting with the client to further understand the change.
Integration.Choice 2: B) Ask the client to raise a formal change request.
Integration.Choice 3: C) Assess the impact of the change with your team.
Integration.Explanation: Steps for Change Request: 1\. Get the change request documented. 2\. Meet the stakeholder to understand the request. 3\. Analyze the impact of the change. 4\. Inform the stakeholder about the impact. 5\. If the change impacts project constraints, send the request to CCB. 6\. Customer or sponsor approval may be required for certain change requests after CCB approval. 7\. Update change log. 8\. If approved, update the plans and baselines. 9\. Inform the stakeholders about the change. 10\. Implement the change.

Integration.Question: A Change request involving scope change has been approved by CCB. The project sponsor is part of the CCB, but the sole technical resource who is planned to work on the change request has suddenly gone for one week of vacation.
