Agile.Question: A project for a new product launch is in a very initial stage and the requirements are evolving Due to stiff competition in the market, the customer would like to launch the product keeping the scope flexible. The project team intends to start the work based on the forecast of a similar project delivered last year Which project approach suits the scenario?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Execute it using the same approach as the reference project.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Execute it as a scrum project.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Execute it as a project with stage gates.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Execute it as a predictive project.
Agile.Explanation: As the requirements are evolving and the customer would like to launch the product keeping the scope flexible, the team should execute it as a scrum project.

Agile.Question: A large organization will transform from a predictive environment to agile methodologies. In its current state, the work in the organization is decomposed into departmental silos, and the employees are best described as specialized contributors. What is the best strategy for this agile transformation?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Establish a fixed date for all projects to transition from predictive to agile.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Use hybrid life cycles as a transition strategy from predictive to agile.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Tailor projects so that the scope is fixed with time and cost being variable.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Introduce some agile techniques to a large and complex project.
Agile.Explanation: A large and complex organization will likely require a gradual approach to transition from predictive to agile methodologies. Incorporating elements of agile within the existing predictive framework will allow for the gradual adoption and acceptance of agile methods.

Agile.Question: The business is anxious to get a portion of the project's creations out into the marketplace to get end user feedback and impressions before the entire product is finished. What must the project team establish for their release to end users?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The Minimal Viable Product
Agile.Choice 2: B) The Sprint Cycle
Agile.Choice 3: C) Transition Plan
Agile.Choice 4: D) Velocity
Agile.Explanation: (Minimum Viable Product) The smallest collection of features that can be included in a product for customers to consider it functional.

Agile.Question: The project deliverables will be developed incrementally over the course of NINE 3-week iterations. Some of the stakeholders are wondering about the approach used to accept the deliverables. How should the project manager respond?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The deliverables will be tested and accepted as part of iteration retrospectives.
Agile.Choice 2: B) The deliverables will be reviewed and accepted as part of the project closure activities.
Agile.Choice 3: C) The deliverables will be reviewed and accepted incrementally throughout the project.
Agile.Choice 4: D) The deliverables will be accepted by end-users at the end of the project.
Agile.Explanation: On agile projects, the deliverables are produced incrementally with every iteration, the development team demonstrates the completed deliverables at the regularly scheduled iteration reviews. The deliverables are reviewed by the product owner and other relevant stakeholders and either accepted or rejected.

Agile.Question: A company uses a hybrid approach to project management and has just completed the first sprint . A team member provided ideas to improve the testing process during the sprint retrospective. What is the next step for the project manager?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Organize a demonstration of the changes in the enterprise system.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Document the lessons learned and implement improvements in the next sprint.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Facilitate a daily standup with the team to track the implementation of changes.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Request that all team members think of ideas to improve processes.
Agile.Explanation: Sprint Retrospective. A meeting of the team members facilitated by the scrum master for the team to identify its own improvements. Where a sprint review reviews the product and identified improvements, the retrospective reviews the team's processes and practices and is used to identify ways the team can improve its performance and collaboration.

Agile.Question: _____________ can be defined as a technique to operate Scrum at scale for multiple teams working on the same product, coordinating discussions of progress on their inter-dependencies, and focusing on how to integrate the delivery of software, especially in areas of overlap.
Agile.Choice 1: A) Large Scale Scrum (LeSS)
Agile.Choice 2: B) Unified scrum
Agile.Choice 3: C) Scrum
Agile.Choice 4: D) Scrum of Scrums
Agile.Explanation: Scrum of Scrums: A technique to operate Scrum at scale for multiple teams working on the same product, coordinating discussions of progress on their interdependencies, and focusing on how to integrate the delivery of software, especially in areas of overlap. [Practice Guide, 1st edition, page 154].

Agile.Question: A project manager is part of a distributed team. The project team is using a product backlog, but due to an excessive workload, the backlog items are not very detailed. In the retrospective, a couple of new team members are raising the issue of knowledge transfer inside the team. What should the project manager do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Hire a technical writer to document the work completed to date and develop a handover document.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Ensure that formal email communication is used when more information is needed to understand the work done.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Ask the team to outline their expectations and confirm with them the approach to use for knowledge transfer.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Organize knowledge-sharing workshops and ask one of the senior team members to facilitate them.
Agile.Explanation: Agile collaboration is the act of working together within that process to achieve a shared goal. The project manager should collaborate with the team to help them find the approach to use for knowledge transfer.

Agile.Question: The project manager was asked to recommend an agile practice to provide business value throughout the project. What should the project manager recommend?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Iterative development and collection of frequent feedback from project team members
Agile.Choice 2: B) Incremental delivery and frequent backlog refinement based on user feedback
Agile.Choice 3: C) Time-boxed iterations to allow the testing team to thoroughly test the product increments
Agile.Choice 4: D) Frequent retrospectives to ensure that lessons learned and improvement actions are implemented
Agile.Explanation: The correct answer is incremental delivery and frequent backlog refinement based on user feedback will provide business value throughout the project.

Agile.Question: Minor impediments may interfere with or slow down day-to-day progress. Which tool or practice can be used to bring attention to those impediments on a regular basis?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Annual Conferences
Agile.Choice 2: B) Daily Standups
Agile.Choice 3: C) Kanban Boards
Agile.Choice 4: D) Lessons Learned
Agile.Explanation: Teams use standups to microcommit to each other, uncover problems, and ensure the work flows smoothly through the team.

Agile.Question: A vendor has been contracted by a buyer to develop a new device. The vendor insisted that the contract thoroughly captures the device specifications. The buyer does not have clear requirements upfront and, therefore, requested that the vendor develop the device using agile. The vendor delivers as per the contract, but the buyer is not satisfied with the outcome. Which Agile Manifesto's value was most likely not appropriately applied?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Customer collaboration over contract negotiations
Agile.Choice 2: B) Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Agile.Choice 3: C) Pair programming over continuous integration
Agile.Choice 4: D) Business people and developers must work together
Agile.Explanation: Thoroughly negotiating contracts is typical for projects that are lead using the traditional approach. In the scenario, however, the customer does not have detailed requirements upfront and requests that the vendor develops the device using agile methods. Collaboration over negotiations would be more beneficial for both parties.

Agile.Question: You and your team are executing the first Agile project in the organization. This is a special project for the organization as Agile is being piloted for the first time. You are nearing the end of the first iteration on the project and not all of the assigned user stories are complete. Can the team extend the iteration duration by a couple of days in order to complete all assigned stories in the iteration plan?
Agile.Choice 1: A) No; the iterations are time-boxed.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Yes; but requires the approval of the product owner.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Yes; but the extension cannot be more than 2 days.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Yes; but requires the approval of the Scrum Master.
Agile.Explanation: Iteration durations are time-boxed and cannot be extended. All incomplete stories need to be returned to the product backlog where they will get re-prioritized along with the other stories in the backlog. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 25]

Agile.Question: The ___________ is also called “the voice of the customer”?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Scrum Master
Agile.Choice 2: B) Product Owner
Agile.Choice 3: C) Development team
Agile.Choice 4: D) Sponsor
Agile.Explanation: Because the Product Owner must understand the needs and priorities of the stakeholders, including customers and users, this role is commonly referred to as the Voice of the Customer. It is the needs and priorities of stakeholders that demand flexibility in applying Scrum.

Agile.Question: A project team that is experienced in the waterfall project management approach has been assigned to their first agile project. To make the transition easier, it has been decided to keep some elements of the waterfall approach in place. During the iteration review, it was realized that a misunderstanding among the development team has led to a duplication of efforts. How might the project manager address this issue?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Do nothing; since the team members are transitioning from waterfall to agile.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Submit a change request to update the communications management plan.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Fallback to a waterfall project management framework going forward.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Bring up the topic during the upcoming iteration retrospective.
Agile.Explanation: Regularly scheduled retrospectives can be used on any project: predictive, agile, or hybrid. Retrospectives provide the project team an opportunity to learn from its previous work, investigate issues, and improve and adapt their processes.

Agile.Question: You have been asked to develop a new website for one of your clients. The website is required to be browser independent and delivered within a month. Although the website has a simple design, the requirement of browser independence has added some complexity to the project. Which of the following approaches would you recommend for this project?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Predictive
Agile.Choice 2: B) Incremental
Agile.Choice 3: C) Iterative
Agile.Choice 4: D) Agile
Agile.Explanation: The project requires a single final delivery. However, project work might require repetitions until all browsers are supported. An iterative approach is ideal in this situation. [PMBOK® Guide 6th edition, page 19]

Agile.Question: During the retrospective of the 5th sprint the project team complains that many obstacles exist with the organization that are creating project delays and rework. What should the project manager do in this situation?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Perform a root cause analysis during the standup meetings.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Include impediment resolutions during daily stand-up meetings.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Create a dedicated sprint to solve the obstacles with the team.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Promote collaboration to help remove the obstacles for the team.
Agile.Explanation: Project managers are serving as servant leaders. The project manager should promote collaboration to help remove the obstacles for the team.

Agile.Question: What does NOT belong to the agile manifesto's main pillars?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Customer collaboration over contract negotiation
Agile.Choice 2: B) Processes over people
Agile.Choice 3: C) Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Agile.Choice 4: D) Working software over comprehensive documentation
Agile.Explanation: In Agile manifesto people and their interactions are considered more valuable when compared to processes. PMI Agile Practice guide page, 08

Agile.Question: A sales manager submitted a new feature request to the product owner, and the request was added to the product backlog. During the sprint planning meeting, the team struggles over which algorithm is the most efficient one to use. The team thinks that some development work is needed to decide. What should the project manager do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Ask the scrum master to choose an algorithm based on the pros and cons of each option.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Create a new item in the sprint backlog to determine the appropriate algorithm.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Request a meeting with the product owner to help clarify the user story.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Invite the sales manager to the next sprint meeting to clarify requirements.
Agile.Explanation: Any work that is related to the product or user stories is the responsibility of the product owner to clarify.

Agile.Question: During a retrospective review, many project team members say they are not completing tasks during the iterations because of interruptions and requests for help from other teams. As a team facilitator, what should the project manager do to avoid this?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Identify the problem's root causes and define the ground rules with all project team members to minimize interferences.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Hire a coach to help all project teams to improve their abilities to solve problems on their own.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Reunite with the project team members affected and tell them not to reduce the team's capacity.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Recommend to the project team members that they should improve their planning and make their stones smaller.
Agile.Explanation: The agile project manager is a servant leader and helps the delivery team self-govern and self-organize. He is a facilitator and communicator. He is a coach and a mentor to the delivery team. He guides and coaches the team and removes impediments.

Agile.Question: An organization wants to transfer from a predictive to an agile approach. What strategy will help the organization with this change?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Assign multiple managers who will be accountable for the agile approach.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Improve organizational readiness by addressing impediments and agile in the organization.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Create a task force of executives who will monitor agile projects on a daily basis.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Take a big bang approach of moving the whole organization to agile at once.
Agile.Explanation: Improve organizational readiness by addressing impediments and agile in the organization.

Agile.Question: A project manager is managing a hybrid project. After attending an iteration review, a stakeholder tells the project manager that they are very busy and asks why these reviews are held so frequently. How should the project manager respond?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Negotiate a reduced review attendance with the stakeholder and update the stakeholder engagement plan to reflect this reduced attendance.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Discuss with the stakeholder the benefits of the hybrid project and how frequent reviews lead to greater value and less rework.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Explain to the stakeholder that the stakeholder engagement plan requires their attendance at all reviews.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Record the issue in the issue log and escalate the conflict to the project sponsor for assistance.
Agile.Explanation: The correct answer is Discussing with the stakeholder the benefits of the hybrid project and how frequent reviews lead to greater value and less rework.

Agile.Question: You are leading a massive knowledge work project. Some team members have complained they have to work overtime in order to complete some of the assigned work. What should you do to resolve this issue?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Establish working agreements.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Call a team for a retrospective meeting.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Establish a Kanban board and set WIP limits.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Launch a root cause analysis.
Agile.Explanation: The problem in unmanageable WIP. The solution is to limit the WIP based on team capacity. A Kanban board can be really helpful in setting this up. A Kanban board provides a means to visualize the flow of work, make impediments easily visible, and allow flow to be managed by adjusting the work in process limits. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 31]

Agile.Question: An iteration is almost finished, but the team is struggling to complete the stories that require more time. What should the project manager do FIRST?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Request approval from the project sponsor to add more resources.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Meet with the project team to develop a proper resolution to the issue.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Update the project artifacts to reflect the new deadlines reported.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Prepare documentation to explain the issue and communicate accordingly.
Agile.Explanation: The best effective way to solve any issue is interactive communication (problem-solving by meetings).

Agile.Question: You are working on a project that is part of a program. All the projects within this program are being managed in an agile way. What is a good technique to get the project teams aligned?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Conduct a Scrum of Scrums.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Assign one customer point of contact for all projects.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Develop one project management plan.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Hold one daily standup meeting for all the projects.
Agile.Explanation: Scrum of Scrums (SoS), also known as “meta Scrum,” is a technique used when two or more Scrum teams consisting of three to nine members each need to coordinate their work instead of one large Scrum team. A representative from each team attends a meeting with the other team representative(s), potentially daily but typically two to three times a week. The daily meeting is conducted similar to the daily standup in Scrum where the representative reports completed work, next set of work, any current impediments, and potential upcoming impediments that might block the other team(s). The goal is to ensure the teams are coordinating work and removing impediments to optimize the efficiency of all the teams.Agile Practice guide page, 111

Agile.Question: As a scrum master, you are facilitating a retrospective for a sprint that failed to meet all of its objectives. Members of the development team and the product owner are arguing over who is responsible for the failure. After performing a root cause analysis, you uncover the source of the conflict. Of the following, what did you most likely discover?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The product owner determined how many user stories were to be completed during the sprint.
Agile.Choice 2: B) The Gantt chart did not include enough story points.
Agile.Choice 3: C) The development team decided how many user stories were to be completed during the sprint.
Agile.Choice 4: D) You, as the scrum master, failed to assign user stories to the development team.
Agile.Explanation: When properly using a scrum framework, the product owner prioritizes the user stories in the product backlog. The product owner, however, should not determine 'how many' user stories will be completed during the sprint. Instead, it is the development team members who decide how many user stories they can commit to completing. If the product owner overcommitted the development team, then the sprint will likely fail to meet some or all of its objectives. Additionally, if the product owner assigns the work to the development team, then the team is less likely to be fully committed to completing the sprint objectives. The incorrect answer choices represent the correct application of scrum best practices or are not relevant to scrum.

Agile.Question: Due to the complexity and the number of requirements, you need someone to provide the guiding direction and requirements prioritization. Ideally, this role should work with the project team and provide product feedback, and set direction on the next piece of functionality to be delivered. In Agile, this role is called?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Product Owner
Agile.Choice 2: B) Scrum Master
Agile.Choice 3: C) Cross-Functional Team Member
Agile.Choice 4: D) Servant-Leader
Agile.Explanation: The product owner is responsible for guiding the direction of the product. Product owners rank the work based on its business value. Product owners work with their teams by providing product feedback and setting direction on the next piece of functionality to be delivered. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 41]

Agile.Question: Every timeboxed iteration in the project has a demo scheduled at the end during the iteration review session. What is the goal of this demo?
Agile.Choice 1: A) To groom the iteration backlog.
Agile.Choice 2: B) To establish the features to be included in the product backlog.
Agile.Choice 3: C) To solicit feedback from the product owner and other stakeholders.
Agile.Choice 4: D) To revise the product roadmap.
Agile.Explanation: The iteration review session: • Hosted at the end of every sprint • Attendees will be the development team, the product owner, scrum master, and sometimes other project stakeholders • Development team will demo the work created in the increment • The group will decide if “Done” has been achieved • The development team and the product owner will discuss the sprint and the remaining items in the product backlog

Agile.Question: A new developer has joined an already formed Development Team. He is constantly in conflict with other team members and the environment is becoming hostile. If necessary, who must identify the problem and begin the resolution process?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The company HR is responsible, being in charge of hiring and firing.
Agile.Choice 2: B) The Development Team is responsible, being a self-organized team, facilitated by the Scrum Master.
Agile.Choice 3: C) The Product Owner is responsible, since he controls the job's return on investment.
Agile.Choice 4: D) The Scrum Master is responsible, since he must remove impediments.
Agile.Explanation: The Development Team is responsible, being a self-organized team, facilitated by the ScrumMaster.

Agile.Question: Ted is a project manager working with a scrum team that is continually missing deadlines. The steering committee is concerned about the project; as it is not clear that it will deliver the expected value. After some analysis, Ted discovers that there is a mismatch of competencies in one of the teams. What should Ted do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Emphasize to the teams the importance of meeting the agreed deadlines.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Update the project schedule to reflect the delay.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Provide appropriate training to compensate for the mismatch.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Accept the risk of the project missing deadlines due to the mismatch.
Agile.Explanation: The project manager should provide appropriate training to compensate for the mismatch.

Agile.Question: On traditional projects, a change control board is usually established to authorize change requests. Who is responsible to authorize changes on an Agile project?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Scrum Master
Agile.Choice 2: B) Agile Team
Agile.Choice 3: C) Product Owner
Agile.Choice 4: D) End Users
Agile.Explanation: Product owners have the ultimate responsibility for the project's success. They prioritize the project backlog and authorize change requests on an Agile project. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 41]

Agile.Question: How should work be allocated to the team in an Agile project?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The most complex tasks should be allocated by the Team Leader (Scrum Master).
Agile.Choice 2: B) Tasks should be randomly allocated to team members, using Planning Poker.
Agile.Choice 3: C) The Team Leader (Scrum Master) should allocate specific tasks to individuals.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Team members should self-select tasks appropriate to their skills.
Agile.Explanation: In Agile Projects, Team members should self-select tasks appropriate to their skills.

Agile.Question: You are managing an e-commerce-enabled website. You have recommended the Agile project management approach to the client and they are happy with any management approach as long as they receive a working product. You and your team have a tough decision to make regarding sprint durations. A sprint duration of two weeks would add a lot of pressure on the team as complex requirements will be tough to build in a single sprint. A sprint duration of six weeks would make the project less Agile but the project might get finished early as the customer won’t get to see many prototypes. What sprint size should be selected?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Four weeks should be selected; as that is the average of two numbers.
Agile.Choice 2: B) A sprint size needs to be determined that maximizes customer value and satisfaction.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Two weeks should be selected; since Agile Manifesto mandates frequent delivery of working software.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Six weeks should be selected; since the project would get finished early and satisfy the customer.
Agile.Explanation: The highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software. A sprint size needs to be determined that maximizes customer value and satisfaction. More information would be required to determine the best duration. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 9]

Agile.Question: A software vendor has recently hired you to manage some of its key projects. During your orientation at the organization, you were told that the organization has recently adopted Agile practices for project management. A chart was then shown to you where Agile and Kanban were shown as a subset of Lean. What is your view on this?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The chart is wrong because Agile is a subset of Lean while Kanban is not.
Agile.Choice 2: B) The chart is wrong because Kanban is a subset of Lean while Agile is not.
Agile.Choice 3: C) The chart is wrong because Agile, Kanban and Lean are three different approaches to project management.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Agile and Kanban are subsets of Lean because they are named instances of Lean thinking.
Agile.Explanation: Agile and Kanban are subsets of Lean because they are named instances of Lean thinking that share Lean concepts such as “focus on value”, “small batch sizes”, and “elimination of waste”. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 11]

Agile.Question: You are leading a complex organizational restructure project. During the project, you would need some timely business decisions to be taken. Who makes business decisions on Agile projects?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Product Owner
Agile.Choice 2: B) Functional Managers
Agile.Choice 3: C) Servant-Leader
Agile.Choice 4: D) End-User
Agile.Explanation: Product owners make decisions on behalf of business stakeholders on Agile projects. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 41]

Agile.Question: An agile team has completed 9 out of 10 stories for the sprint. During the retrospective, a few team members pointed out that they finished all of their stories. However, one team member failed to finish a story. What should the agile leader do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Suggest that the team assign stories at the beginning of the sprint based on each person's strengths to maximize performance.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Work with the product owner to remove the story from the sprint.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Emphasize to the team that each member is responsible for their story, but the team is collectively responsible for finishing the sprint.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Ask the team to address this at the next sprint planning instead of at the retrospective.
Agile.Explanation: The correct answer is emphasizing to the team that each member is responsible for their story, but the team is collectively responsible for finishing the sprint.

Agile.Question: During the execution of a hybrid project, one developer had to be replaced. The new resource is extremely competent in quality assurance tasks but does not have much experience in development. What should the project manager do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Maintain the same task allocation structure to avoid any disruption in the project team.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Move the developer to another team and look for a replacement developer.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Request that all quality assurance tasks be allocated to the new resource.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Allow the team to reevaluate the tasks and determine how they should be allocated.
Agile.Explanation: The agile team should be self-organized and self-directed, cross-functional team, generalizing specialist.

Agile.Question: A product owner has returned from a meeting with a few key stakeholders, who expressed interest in learning more about the project progress. The product owner is seeking the project manager's recommendation on how to approach this request. What should the project manager do to help the product owner?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Provide an overview of the completed functionalities and release plan, and capture expectations for future stakeholder involvement.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Remind the product owner of stakeholder accountability, and ask the product owner to determine the appropriate next steps.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Provide access to the latest user acceptance test (UAT) environment so they can see the solution.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Encourage the product owner to invite key stakeholders to future demonstrations where they can provide feedback.
Agile.Explanation: The correct answer is encouraging he product owner to invite key stakeholders to future demonstrations where they can provide feedback.

Agile.Question: During the Sprint Planning Meeting, the amount of work necessary for fulfilling the items requested by the Product Owner seems greater than the Development Team's capacity. Which action makes more sense?
Agile.Choice 1: A) The Product Owner demands that the Development Team work overtime just for this Sprint, provided this doesn't happen again.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Cancel the Sprint.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Increasing the number of Sprints.
Agile.Choice 4: D) The Development Team and Product Owner collaborate, with a view to removing or modifying items.
Agile.Explanation: The Development Team and Product Owner collaborate, with a view to removing or modifying items.

Agile.Question: You have been hired by as a Project Manager in an organization that has recently transitioned to Agile practices. During your first week at work, you have noticed that your team hasn’t fully embraced Agile. What should you do?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Set WIP limits.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Put on the Agile coach hat.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Escalate the matter to product owner.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Negotiate for better-qualified resources.
Agile.Explanation: When working on an Agile project, project managers shift from being the center to serving the team and the management. In an Agile environment, project managers are servant leaders, changing their emphasis to coaching people who want help, fostering greater collaboration on the team, and aligning stakeholder needs. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 38]

Agile.Question: An integrated project involves the interaction of both hardware and software, and the sponsor has approved the schedule management plan. The project team evaluated the product’s feasibility of functionality and accelerated testing. What should the project manager do as a servant leader?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Support the team as necessary to find the minimum viable product (MVP).
Agile.Choice 2: B) Develop the product as per the schedule to perform integration and testing.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Submit a change request to the project sponsor for accelerated testing.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Amend the project budget to include MVP testing.
Agile.Explanation: The project manager, as a servant leader, should support the team as necessary to find the minimum viable product (MVP).

Agile.Question: The project manager has determined that the team's velocity has been 50 points for each of the first five sprints with an SPI of 0.83 over the same time period. How should the project manager respond to the team's performance?
Agile.Choice 1: A) Submit a change request to revise the project schedule baseline.
Agile.Choice 2: B) Suggest that the team set more realistic goals during sprint planning.
Agile.Choice 3: C) Crash the schedule in order to get productivity back on track.
Agile.Choice 4: D) Assign the team 60 story points for each sprint going forward.
Agile.Explanation: It seems as if the team over-committed by planning 60 story points per sprint. Since the team has established a stable velocity of 50 story points per sprint, it is unrealistic to keep committing to completing 60 points, all else being equal.

Agile.Question: What are the rules about the length of a Sprint?
Agile.Choice 1: A) 2 weeks
Agile.Choice 2: B) 1-4 weeks
Agile.Choice 3: C) 1 week
Agile.Choice 4: D) Up to 10 weeks
Agile.Explanation: Scrum is run on timeboxes of 1 month or less with consistent durations called sprints where a potentially releasable increment of product is produced.

full-exam-1.Question: The project manager and the team decide that the project will be divided into five-week iterations with two weeks in between for retrospectives and iteration planning. Where should this approach be documented?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Schedule Management Plan
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Product Backlog
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Project Charter
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Activity List
full-exam-1.Explanation: The schedule management plan documents the arrangement and desired designs of the schedules to be used in a project. This includes the timeboxed segments agreed on by the agile team.

full-exam-1.Question: You are the project manager of a project. The project you are managing has experienced quality issues, which were the fault of one of the suppliers. Much of the rework the supplier has billed for in the final invoice of $20,000 was created by their quality issues. Therefore, you arrived at a revised amount of $18,000 to be paid. You sent the payment of $18,000 along with your justification, but the supplier reinvoiced with a balance due of $2,000. What is your best course of action now?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Negotiate with the supplier.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR)
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Contact the legal team about pursuing legal action against the supplier.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Ignore the supplier's second invoice and consider your payment of $18,000 payment in full.
full-exam-1.Explanation: In general, and as prescribed by the PMBOK Guide, disputes between the buyer and seller should be resolved according to the dispute resolution clause in the contract. In this question, no specifics are given about remedies for settling disputes in the agreement, nor are there any facts to support whose total is fair/correct. In the absence of that type of information, the typical approach to resolve a dispute in a procurement situation is for the parties to enter into a negotiation in hopes that the difference can be addressed through a negotiated settlement. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 498.

full-exam-1.Question: In a daily standup meeting, a team member indicates that they found a big risk that was previously unknown. How should the agile coach proceed?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Use the rest of the standup meeting to discuss this important issue.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Ask to meet with the developer after the meeting to get more details.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Escalate the risk to the customer.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Ask the affected team members to stay after the meeting to discuss the issue in more detail.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Issues that arise from the daily standup meeting are discussed immediately after the meeting. Keeping the discussion of the issue outside of the daily standup ensures that the pace of the daily standup is maintained and that all team members get their chance to speak.

full-exam-1.Question: One of your contractors is not performing to the agreed-upon standards. You want to terminate the contract and engage another contractor for the same job. You need to determine the specific legal procedure for the early termination of the contract. What should you do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Look at the scope statement.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Consult the contract.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Review the risk register.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Check the procurement management plan.
full-exam-1.Explanation: A properly drafted contract will contain a termination clause that specifies the rights of the seller or buyer when a contract needs to be terminated. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 489.

full-exam-1.Question: An agile project manager has contracted with a vendor to develop some of the deliverables required for the project. The vendor is also using an agile project management approach to deliver their work. How should the progress of the vendor be assessed?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) By reviewing the weekly progress reports from the vendor.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) By attending the vendor team's daily stand up meetings.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) By reviewing the released versions of the vendor's work.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) By conducting procurement audits of the vendor's processes.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The seventh guiding principle of the agile manifesto indicates, "Working software is the primary measure of progress."

full-exam-1.Question: The project you are leading has a current CPI of 1.0 and SPI of 0.8. You have been notified by the project management office that your project has been selected for a quality audit that is scheduled to take place over the coming weeks. What should be your primary concern with regards to the audit?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) That the project falls back in line with the project schedule.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) That the work performed lines up with company policies, processes, and procedures.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Assuring that the project products fall within the sponsor's acceptance limits.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Finding errors, defects, bugs, or other nonconformance problems in the product.
full-exam-1.Explanation: A quality audit is a structured, independent process used to determine if project activities comply with organizational and project policies, processes, and procedures. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 294.

full-exam-1.Question: The product owner meets with the project team members to discuss the user stories for the next iteration. The product owner points out the user stories that hold the highest value, while the team indicates which user stories bear the highest risk. By the end of the meeting, the user stories in the product backlog are prioritized and the team knows how to develop them. What process have the product owner and the team just performed?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Iteration Planning
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Develop Schedule
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Backlog Refinement
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Stakeholder Analysis
full-exam-1.Explanation: Discussing the value of the user stories and the risk associated with them, eventually resulting in a prioritized backlog, can be best described by backlog refinement. Backlog refinement is the progressive elaboration of project requirements (user stories) in which the team and relevant stakeholders, such as the productive owner, collaboratively review and update the requirements to satisfy customer needs. An iteration backlog is typically prioritized based on the value a user story represents for the customer combined with the risk associated with the user story. An outcome is a prioritized iteration backlog. As the work progresses, the product owner, together with the team, works with the stakeholders to prioritize the product backlog, identify new items, refine existing items, and clean up items that are no longer needed. This process is called backlog refinement and must be performed continuously throughout the project. Backlog refinement is also referred to as backlog grooming. Agile Practice Guide, Pages 52-53.

full-exam-1.Question: The project team has just completed its fourth sprint. As part of the control costs process, you determine that the team's average velocity is 50 points per sprint, and the team has earned 1/2 of the total number of story points required to complete the entire project. The average cost per story point is $500. What is the estimate to complete the remaining work?
full-exam-1.Explanation: The team has completed 200 story points (4 sprints with 50 story points each) which is 1/2 of the total amount of story points for the project. If 200 story points represent 1/2 of the total scope, then the total scope is 400 story points, leaving 200 story points remaining to be completed. Using the remaining number of story points on the project, 200, you need to multiply it by the average cost per story point, $500, to determine the expected cost for completing the remainder of the project. Following are the detailed calculations in this situation: Total story points completed = 200. Total story points remaining = 200. Average cost per story point = $500. Remaining cost for project completion = 200 * $500= $100,000

full-exam-1.Question: A project team member identifies a simple change that will improve product quality without impacting the project budget. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Have team members include it in their assignments as quickly as possible.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) After reviewing the change, include it in the quality management plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Ask the sponsor for their advice regarding the suggested change.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Meet with the team member to assess the impact and follow the change control process.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The change does not impact the budget, but may impact the other constraints. Therefore, the project manager should meet with the team member to assess the impact and follow the change control process.

full-exam-1.Question: Sara is managing a pharmaceutical research project. Her research officer tells her that she needs to plan his research activity so that it finishes before the documentation begins. Other than that, he says it can start as late in the project as necessary. What is the relationship between the research activity and the documentation activity?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Finish-to-Finish
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Start-to-Finish
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Finish-to-Start
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Start-to-Start
full-exam-1.Explanation: It is a simple finish to start relationship. Even if you schedule the activity as late as possible, it does not change the relationship.

full-exam-1.Question: Two highly skilled and knowledgeable resources on your project are in conflict over the best technical solution to meet a project requirement. However, this is not affecting the project schedule. Who is initially responsible for the conflict resolution?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) The project manager is initially responsible for the conflict resolution.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Either of the team members is responsible for the conflict resolution.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) The project sponsor is initially responsible for the conflict resolution.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Both team members are initially responsible for the conflict resolution.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Initially, both team members are responsible for the conflict resolution. If the conflict escalates, the project manager should help facilitate a satisfactory resolution. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 348.

full-exam-1.Question: A risk that was not listed in the risk register occurred. In order to obtain funding to respond to this risk, what will you do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Estimate the cost of the action and take it from the management reserve which is part of the project budget.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Estimate the cost of the action and take it from the approved cost baseline.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Estimate the cost of the action, take it from the approved cost baseline, but reduce this amount from the baseline.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Estimate the cost of the action and take it from the contingency reserve which is part of the time phased budget.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Estimate the cost of the action and take it from the management reserve which is part of the project budget.

full-exam-1.Question: You are working on a project that consists of three releases, five iterations per release. The first release will provide the must-have features required for a minimum viable product with additional features added after each subsequent release. The customer wants to know which features will be available at the end of each iteration. What is the best tool or technique to use in this situation?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Critical Path Method
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Agile Release Planning
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Activity List
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Schedule Baseline
full-exam-1.Explanation: Agile release planning provides a high-level summary timeline of the release schedule and defines which features will be available at the end of each iteration.

full-exam-1.Question: You have been hired by as a project manager in an organization that has recently transitioned to Agile practices. During your first week at work, you have noticed that your team has not fully embraced Agile. What should you do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Negotiate for better-qualified resources.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Put on the Agile coach hat.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Escalate the matter to product owner.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Set WIP limits.
full-exam-1.Explanation: When working on an Agile project, project managers shift from being the center to serving the team and the management. In an Agile environment, project managers are servant leaders, changing their emphasis to coaching people who want help, fostering greater collaboration on the team, and aligning stakeholder needs. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st edition, Page 38]

full-exam-1.Question: Your project team has recently completed the 3rd iteration on the project. So far, 45 story points have been successfully delivered to the customer. For this project, the iteration size is fixed at three weeks. Looking at the backlog, you have 150 story points remaining to be delivered. What is the project’s current velocity?
full-exam-1.Explanation: Velocity = average story points per iteration. Since the team had delivered 45 story points in three iterations, the velocity is 45/3 = 15 story points per iteration. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 61.

full-exam-1.Question: While performing project work, a team member notices that there is a potential new risk, which could impact the project's critical path. What should the team member do immediately?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Draft an emergency fallback plan; since the critical path is in jeopardy.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Document the risk in the risk register.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Recommend the project be placed on hold for a day to avoid the risk.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Generate a risk report using qualitative analysis of the identified risk to alert the team of the schedule impacts.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The risk register acts as a repository in which identified risks are recorded, including the outputs of other risk management processes. The immediate first step for the team member to take is to document the new risk in the risk register so that it will not be forgotten. The team member should then consult the project risk management plan for information about what to do next.

full-exam-1.Question: You are in the norming stage of the Tuckman model when a difficult choice needs to be made on the implementation of a scope change. The senior team lead is pushing for option A because he has experience in the area. However, the rest of the team wants to use option B because it will be using some new technology that will reduce the complexity of the implementation. You decide that you will follow the senior member's recommendation. This is an example of what?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Win-win
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Compromising
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Forcing
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Withdrawal
full-exam-1.Explanation: Since you have decided in favor of one side, this is an example of forcing power. Force/direct. Pushing one’s viewpoint at the expense of others; offering only win-lose solutions, usually enforced through a power position to resolve an emergency. This approach often results to a win-lose situation. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 349.

full-exam-1.Question: During the planning phase of a project, the project manager learns that the sponsor has eliminated some important deliverables in other projects over the past three years, producing a negative cost variance. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Document the lessons learned.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Include the risk in the risk register.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Define the scope baseline correctly.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Document the issue in the issue log.
full-exam-1.Explanation: In the past project, the project sponsor eliminated some important deliverables causing negative cost variance. This considers risk and should be included in the risk register.

full-exam-1.Question: You are working on a project with 10 stakeholders. The number of communication channels on this project is:
full-exam-1.Explanation: The number of communication channels = N(N-1)/2. You + 10 stakeholders = 11 so, 11*10/2 = 55.

full-exam-1.Question: During regular team meetings, the project manager notices that there are clear signs of conflict and issues related to unclear task assignments and ownership. What should the project manager do to address this?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Meet individually with team members to understand the conflicts and issues.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Change the structure of the regular project meetings to improve communication.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Investigate possible ways to improve team collaboration and morale.
full-exam-1.Explanation: A RACI Matrix is a useful tool to use to ensure clear assignment of roles and responsibilities when the team consists of internal and external resources. Therefore, the project manager should define and obtain agreement on a responsible accountable, consult, and inform RACI Matrix to address this situation.

full-exam-1.Question: You are a project manager working closely with your procurement administrator to ensure that all claims, invoices, and final payments have been finalized with the vendor. Terms and conditions of the contract have been met, and all deliverables have been accepted. What should you do next?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Carry out a structured review of the procurement process.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Notify the vendor that the contract has been completed.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Conduct the final inspection of the vendor's deliverables.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Finalize all activities for the project and release the project team.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Closed procurements are an output of the control procurements process implied by the scenario. The buyer should provide the seller (vendor) with a formal written notice that the contract has been completed. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 499.

full-exam-1.Question: One month into a 12-month project., a vendor informs the project manager that required project equipment will be delayed. After further investigation, the project manager learns that this vendor has a reputation for underperforming. What should the project manager have done to prevent this?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Checked the updated risk register and issue log.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Reviewed the lessons learned documents from other projects.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Added a backup vendor to the vendor list.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Included a contingency buffer in the schedule baseline.
full-exam-1.Explanation: To prevent this situation, the project manager should have reviewed the lessons learned documents from other projects to know more about the reputation of vendor.

full-exam-1.Question: An agile project has entered its seventh sprint. Two days before the end of the sprint, the customer informs the product owner that they forgot to include one feature in the sprint. A senior manager overhears the conversation and states that including the feature represents scope creep and should not be allowed. What is the product owner's best course of action?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Request that the customer submits a change request.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Instruct the team to develop the feature in the current sprint.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Reject the feature as instructed by the senior manager.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Work with the customer to prioritize the feature in the product backlog.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Agile best practices suggest that the product owner should let the team finish the work that has been assigned to the team members for the current sprint and then, with the customer, prioritize the feature that has been forgotten by the customer in the product backlog.

full-exam-1.Question: During a software project, a project manager notices that the coding quality for one developer is statistically lower than another developer assigned the same task. Which tool should the project manager use to trace the problem’s source back to its actionable root cause?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Scatter Diagram
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Ishikawa Diagram
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Histogram
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Control Chart
full-exam-1.Explanation: Cause-and-effect diagrams “fishbone diagrams or Ishikawa diagrams” trace the problem’s source back to its actionable root cause. Fishbone diagrams often prove useful in linking the undesirable effects seen as special variation to the assignable cause upon which project teams should implement corrective actions to eliminate the special variation detected in a control chart.

full-exam-1.Question: The established upper and lower control limits are 12 and -12 while you have the following data points readings: 1.6, 3.7, 7.8, 9.1, - 6.8, 14, 8.9, 4.2, 0.0, - 5.2. How will you consider this process?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Out of control
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) It has predictable performance
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) In control
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Cannot be determined
full-exam-1.Explanation: There is one point out of control limit (14) so, the process is out of control.

full-exam-1.Question: As a project manager, if you would like to check if your project still aligns with the organizational goals, which document will help you?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Issue Log
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Business Need
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Business Case
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Product Scope Description
full-exam-1.Explanation: Projects are initiated to realize business opportunities that are aligned with an organization’s strategic goals. Prior to initiating a project, a business case is often developed to outline the project objectives, the required investment, and financial and qualitative criteria for project success. The business case provides the basis to measure success and progress throughout the project life cycle by comparing the results with the objectives and the identified success criteria. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 546.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following business documents justify why the project is authorized?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Project Management Plan
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Business Case
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Scope Statement of Work
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Project Charter
full-exam-1.Explanation: The business need and the cost-benefit analysis are contained in the business case to justify and establish boundaries for the project. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 77.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following processes are concerned with comparing the work results with the quality requirements to ensure the result is acceptable?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Control Scope
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Manage Quality
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Control Quality
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Validate Scope
full-exam-1.Explanation: Control quality is concerned with comparing the work results with the quality requirements to ensure the result is acceptable. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 272.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following documents links product requirements from their origin to the deliverables that satisfy them and provides a structure for managing changes to the product scope?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Project Charter
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Requirements Documentation
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Requirements Tractability Matrix
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Risk Register
full-exam-1.Explanation: Requirements traceability matrix is a grid that links product requirements from their origin to the deliverables that satisfy them. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 148.

full-exam-1.Question: The project manager for a virtual team is struggling to track progress and productivity because the team is spread out over several time zones. What should the project manager do to enhance communication?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Establish an information-sharing portal.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Set up a Kanban board.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Update the lessons learned register.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Create and update the issue log.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Communication technology is important in addressing the team development issues in co-located and virtual teams. It helps build a harmonious environment for the co-located team and a better understanding for the virtual team, especially those working in different time zones. Examples of communication technology that may be used are shared portal. A shared repository for information sharing (e.g., website, collaboration software or internet) is effective for virtual project team. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 340.

full-exam-1.Question: A project manager wants to ensure sufficient stakeholder participation throughout a project’s life cycle. What should the project manager include in the stakeholder engagement plan?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Stakeholder power/interest grid
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Feedback from stakeholders on project operations
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Desired and current stakeholder engagement levels
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Change requests initiated by stakeholders
full-exam-1.Explanation: A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix supports comparison between the current engagement levels of stakeholders and the desired engagement levels required for successful project delivery. To ensure sufficient stakeholder participation throughout a project’s life cycle, the project manager should include the desired and current stakeholder engagement levels in the stakeholder engagement plan.

full-exam-1.Question: You have just been assigned to an upcoming agile project. As part of pre-project work, you review all of the organization's policies and procedures regarding compliance. You realize that only some of them may be applicable to your project. What should you do first?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Classify the compliance categories to determine the expenditure of project resources.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Incorporate all compliance policies and procedures in the implementation strategy.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Ensure compliance activities are included in the project schedule baseline.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Switch the project management approach from agile to traditional.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The scenario describes a situation where only some compliance-related policies and procedures for an agile project will be applicable. One of the principles outlined in the Agile Manifesto states, "Simplicity - the art of maximizing the amount of work not done - is essential." Compliance activities represent overhead, which does not directly provide value. In keeping with an agile mindset, the project manager should minimize the overhead and only include those compliance activities that are necessary. Classifying the compliance categories that have been captured in the organization's policies and procedures may be helpful in differentiating those that require the expenditure of resources and those that do not. For example, the organization may have specific guidelines for complying with union rules and activities. However, if the project underway will not have union involvement, then that entire compliance category can be disregarded.

full-exam-1.Question: A recently appointed project manager is in constant conflict with a senior manager. Since this is not ideal for the team, the project manager wants to resolve this. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Request scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Escalate the issue to the project sponsor.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Seek guidance from the other project managers.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Enlist the help of a neutral mediator.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should request scheduled face-to-face meetings with the senior manager. This is an example of problem-solving technique (The best conflict resolutions technique).

full-exam-1.Question: The development team is having difficulty finding a suitable time to hold the daily standup because they are located in three different time zones. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Replace the daily standup with a daily report.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Encourage frequent, small team meetings with two or three team members.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Let the team members decide themselves if they want to join the meeting.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Require all team members to join the daily standup regardless of the meeting time.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The different time zones will not prevent the team from holding the daily standup meeting. This meeting is essential for agile projects. Therefore, the project manager should require all team members to join the daily standup regardless of the meeting time. Other options are not the best practice for an agile project such as (Replace the daily standup with a daily report, Let the team members decide themselves if they want to join the meeting, and encourage frequent, small team meetings with two or three team members only.

full-exam-1.Question: A new government regulation requires financial resources to be added to a project. Due to this regulation, a new stakeholder requests to add another project activity. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Update the schedule to include the new activity because it was requested by the key stakeholder.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Execute the new activity because it was requested by the key stakeholder.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Use funding allocated to other activities to execute the key stakeholder's request.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Document the request from the key stakeholder and perform the change request procedure.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should document the request from the key stakeholder and perform the change request procedure. Other options are not correct because the change request should be approved before updating the plan or executing the new activity.

full-exam-1.Question: A production phase was stopped because the inspector claimed that regulatory labels were missing. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Review the risk management plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Review the quality management plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Update the lessons learned register.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Carry out an assessment by SME.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should review the quality management plan because it includes the major procedures relevant for the project, such as dealing with the nonconformance, corrective actions procedures, and continuous improvement procedures. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 286.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following activities is the most important to perform to help manage a project meeting?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Limit the meeting to a specific length of time.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Ensure that every attendee has a chance to speak.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Create and follow an agenda.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Follow up on action items.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Creating and following an agenda is the most important activity you can perform when managing project meetings. The meeting agenda sets the tone, the length, and the format of how the meeting will be conducted. Using a formal agenda makes it easy to create meeting minutes and follow up action items after the meeting. Ensuring that every attendee has a chance to speak may be important for some meetings, but not necessarily for all meetings. Limiting the meeting to a specific length of time, in general, is good practice and will help you end your meeting on time but it is not as critical when compared to creating and following an agenda. At times, meetings may run over time for it to fulfill the agenda. Following up on action items is also important, but this occurs after the meeting itself.

full-exam-1.Question: The project vendor you selected to provide materials for your project has many problems with the quality control department and he experienced a lot of conflict with them in the previous time. As a project manager, what should you do next?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Raise the issue to sponsor.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Bring the vendor to meet the control quality department and follow the quality procedures.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Directing the quality department to reject all materials related to the vendor.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Perform quality audits.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should be proactive and manage the conflict between the quality control department and the vendor. Therefore, the project manager should bring the vendor to meet the control quality department and follow the quality procedures.

full-exam-1.Question: A project manager receives an email from a vendor that key deliverables will be delayed by a month. What should the project manager do first?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Assess the impact of the delay on the project plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Update the management and obtain their advice.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Meet with the team and identify ways to absorb this delay.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Call the vendor to obtain a justification for the delay.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should FIRST assess the impact of the delay on the project plan then take the corrective action such as meeting with the team and identifying ways to absorb this delay to find solutions. Option (Update the management and obtain their advice) is not good a practice; as the project manager should be proactive and find ways to solve the problems with the team members. Option (Call the vendor to obtain a justification for the delay) is not good also because he already received an email from a vendor that a key deliverable will be delayed by a month and the calling not will be useful.

full-exam-1.Question: In your project, there is a confusion amongst the project stakeholders on where to find materials and information for the project. What is the BEST response to address this issue?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Distribute all the project documents, materials, and updates to each stakeholder.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Require all stakeholders to attend every meeting to ensure that everyone receives the handouts and information.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Assign one project team member to retain and distribute all the project materials and information to have a single point of contact.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Set up an information management system to store, share, and codify the project's knowledge and content.
full-exam-1.Explanation: As a project progresses, there can be a lot of information and systems especially in a large, complex project with many stakeholders. The root issue in this scenario is the inability of stakeholders to locate the materials and the information they need. Building up the information management tools would assist the project stakeholders to access and locate the information needed or requested. All other options describe infeasible, counterproductive, or unmanageable responses.

full-exam-1.Question: Some key decisions are affected because of the contracting views between the organization’s senior management and external stakeholders. Therefore, the project manager realizes that a project will be delayed. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Re-baseline the scope and project’s schedule to take into account delays in decision making.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Review the sufficiency of the project’s governance and ensure that an appropriate structure is in place.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Review the stakeholder register and ensure that communications plan is being followed.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Isolate the project team members from senior management and stakeholder so that decisions can be made more quickly.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Organizations use governance guidelines to establish strategic direction and performance parameters. a project governance framework can include: • Project success and deliverable acceptance criteria. • Process to identify, escalate, and resolve issues. • Relationship between project team, organizational groups, and external stakeholders. • Project organization chart with project roles. • Communication processes and procedures. • Processes for project decision-making. • Guidelines for aligning project governance and organizational strategy. Therefore, the Review of the sufficiency of the project’s governance and ensure that an appropriate structure is in place is the correct answer.

full-exam-1.Question: During a project status meeting, a team member informs the project manager of an unexpected increase in the price of an essential component required to complete the deliverable. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Update the risk management plan to adapt to the new scenario.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Refer to the procurement management plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Include the increased price in the project budget.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Analyze the impact of the price increase on the project.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should analyze the impact of the price increase on the project.

full-exam-1.Question: In your organization, a project management team has subcontracted work to a service company. The process of ensuring that this service company's performance meets contractual requirements is called:
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Plan Procurement Management
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Close Procurements
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Risk Management Plan
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Control Procurements
full-exam-1.Explanation: Control procurements is the process of managing procurement relationships, monitoring contract performance, and making changes and/or corrections as needed.

full-exam-1.Question: A collection of related projects that are managed in a coordinated way to obtain benefits is called a:
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Portfolio
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Suite
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Colocation
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Program
full-exam-1.Explanation: The PMBOK Guide defines a Program as: "a group of related projects, subsidiary programs, and program activities managed in a coordinated manner to obtain benefits not available from managing them individually".

full-exam-1.Question: The project charter has been signed for a critical project, but the project scope statement has not been prepared. Management asks the project manager to move forward with the project without an approved project scope statement. As a project manager, what should you do next?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Refuse to work on the project because management is not following standard project management practices.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Meet with the management to explain the potential problems with running a project without a project scope statement.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Start the project with inputs from the project charter to save time.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Escalate the issue to the project sponsor and add it to the risk register.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project manager should FIRST meet with the management to explain the potential problems with running a project without a project scope statement. The other options (Refuse, Escalate or Start the project without scope statement) are not correct because the question asks about the first step. Always the first step is meeting (the most effective communication way).

full-exam-1.Question: You have recommended developing a business case for each of the organizational projects followed by the development of a project benefits management plan. Who would you recommend to be the owner of the business case?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Project Sponsor
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Project Manager
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Change Control Board
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Project Team
full-exam-1.Explanation: The project sponsor is generally accountable for the development and maintenance of the project business case document. The project manager is responsible for providing recommendations and oversight to keep the project business case, project management plan, project charter, and project benefits management plan success measures in alignment with one another and with the goals and objectives of the organization. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 29.

full-exam-1.Question: Monthly audits were performed to determine if project activities comply with corporate policies, procedures, and best practices. Throughout the project, the results of the monthly audits indicated that the team was in compliance. However, at the end of the project, it was determined that some of the project activities did not comply with organizational policies. What most likely caused these compliance gaps to be missed during the audits?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) The audits were conducted by an auditor external to the organization.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) The audits were conducted by the project management office (PMO).
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) The audits were conducted by the company's internal audit department.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) The audits were conducted by one of the project team members.
full-exam-1.Explanation: An audit is usually performed by an entity external to the team. Having a project team member perform the audit disproves the benefits of an independent review making this choice the best answer to the question asked.

full-exam-1.Question: While creating the probability and impact matrix, what should the team and project manager consider to support the project risk analysis?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Possible effects on the objectives of the project.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Contingency reserve for budget and schedule.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Project scope and project deliverables.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Project quality and resources.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The most important element that the team and project manager should consider while creating the probability and impact matrix is the possible effects on the objectives of the project by taking the highest priority level regardless of which objective is affected. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 425.

full-exam-1.Question: A project manager has ongoing issues with a pre-qualified seller who has repeatedly failed to meet quality standards outlined by the company. The seller has also been unresponsive when the project manager has tried to resolve the quality issues. The project manager wants to ensure that this seller will not be considered again for future contracts. What is the best course of action for the project manager to take in this situation?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Update the project management plan.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Capture the information in the issue log.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Recommend removing the seller from the prequalified sellers list.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Conduct a procurement audit.
full-exam-1.Explanation: Prequalified seller list is an organizational process asset, which contains potential sellers who are previously qualified (approved). These lists can be updated according to the control procurements process, and sellers can be disqualified and removed from the lists based on their poor performance.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following processes should be used to implement agreed-upon risk response plans? The benefit of this process is that it ensures that agreed-upon risk responses are executed as planned.
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Identify Risk
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Implement Risk Responses
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Monitor Risk
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Plan Risk management
full-exam-1.Explanation: Implement Risk Responses is the process of implementing agreed-upon risk response plans. The key benefit of this process is that it ensures that agreed-upon risk responses are executed as planned to address overall project risk exposure, minimize individual project threats, and maximize individual project opportunities. PMBOK 6th Edition, Page 449.

full-exam-1.Question: A project team is working on a risk response strategy by evaluating every risk and coming up with suitable response strategies. However, one particular risk with a negative impact cannot be avoided or mitigated. Furthermore, there is no way to transfer risk by outsourcing or buying insurance. What is the best the team can do about the risk?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Revisit the Risk Response Strategy.
full-exam-1.Choice 2: B) Accept the risk.
full-exam-1.Choice 3: C) Treat it as a secondary risk and update it in the Risk Register.
full-exam-1.Choice 4: D) Share the risk by allocating ownership to a third party.
full-exam-1.Explanation: The question suggests that the team has already explored all the alternatives so, option (Revisit the Risk Response Strategy) would not provide any further solution. In this case, the best strategy is to accept the risk and, if possible, plan for a contingency to be implemented if risk occurs. Option (Share the risk by allocating ownership to a third party) is a strategy for positive risks or opportunities. Option (Treat it as a secondary risk and update it in the Risk Register) is not true; as a secondary risk is an outcome of implementing a risk response strategy.

full-exam-1.Question: Which of the following practices is recommended for a vendor company to use while contracting with a customer for an agile project?
full-exam-1.Choice 1: A) Using standard form contracts recommended by the project management office.
