full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) After the contract has been awarded to keep alternatives open
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Prior to the submission of a bid or proposal by the bidder
full-exam-2.Explanation: Bidder Conference is a T&T used in the process "Conduct Procurement", and the output of this is "Selected sellers" so, it has to be before awarding the contract, but it takes place "Prior to the submission" and not “after submission of bid" so that vendors can take inputs from these meetings before final submission. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 487.

full-exam-2.Question: You have been assigned as a project manager to a software project. Before creating your product, you decided to create a prototype to ensure that it is acceptable to stakeholders. This is an example of:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Risk Transference
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Risk Mitigation
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Risk Avoidance
full-exam-2.Explanation: In risk mitigation, action is taken to reduce the probability of occurrence and/or impact of a threat. Early mitigation action is often more effective than trying to repair the damage after the threat has occurred. Adopting less complex processes, conducting more tests, or choosing a more stable seller are examples of mitigation actions. Mitigation may involve prototype development to reduce the risk of scaling up from a bench-scale model of a process or product. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 443.

full-exam-2.Question: A certain stakeholder keeps asking for changes to the project scope that are not consistent with the original project requirements. One of the changes was requested one month before the project launch date. This change is projected to cause significant project delays. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Update the change management document.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Inform the project steering committee about the project delay risk.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Continue with the launch date as per the approved project management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Submit a change request to the change control board (CCB).
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should submit a change request to the change control board (CCB) for reviewing and approval.

full-exam-2.Question: After a certain duration wherein team members have worked with each other, the team members have begun to adjust themselves to other team members. Trust among the members has also increased. As their project manager, you are pleased with this situation. What will you do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Bring them to a stage where conflicts are minimum.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Bring them to the performing stage of the Tuckman ladder of team development.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Allow them to continue at this performance level and then release the team members once the project is over.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Bring them to a stage where you can begin delegating tasks to the team so that the project is successful.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The team is presently in the Norming stage of the Tuckman ladder of team development. The next stage is the Performing stage.

full-exam-2.Question: One of the sellers has completed their work as specified in the contract and you are proceeding to close out the purchase. Your quality team is not satisfied with the work; as the machining tolerances are not as close as they had hoped for. You need to do which of the following with the seller?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Close out the procurement and start a new contract for any rework.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Request from seller to issue a change request.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Request that they rework the parts to the specified tolerances.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The question states that the work is done to specifications. If you need to have some parts reworked, a new contract needs to be written up. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 499.

full-exam-2.Question: A project team has examined the degree of variance relative to the scope baseline. The project manager needs to know if the variance has been improving or deteriorating as the project has progressed. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Conduct product analysis.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Perform variance analysis.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Complete stakeholder analysis.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Trend analysis is a data analysis technique that examines project performance over time to determine if performance is improving or deteriorating. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 170.

full-exam-2.Question: Some of your organization's department who are collaborating together for a project have found a great way to include a few subject matter experts in their project even though those experts will work from another geography. You are appointed as the project manager while this project is in the executing phase. You notice some conflicts in the project team due to this arrangement of people working from remote locations. What will you do first to improve the situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Hold frequent meetings with the geography resources.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Bring the other geography resources to the local office for a day every month to meet the local members face to face.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Improve the communications plan for the project.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Exchange the locations of the other geography resources with the local resources.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Communications planning is very important in a virtual team environment like this. Having the other geography resources meet with local resources face to face once in a while will be useful, but the communications plan will decide what communications actions like this will be performed. Apart from this, facilitating communications, setting clear expectations within the team, developing protocols for conflict resolution, including people from all locations in decision making, understanding cultural differences, sharing credit during success are also important. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 333.

full-exam-2.Question: A team member is continuously improving. This team member has been a role model and mentor to others in the organization. How should the project manager acknowledge this team member's commitment?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Appreciate this team member's performance throughout the project life cycle.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Document it in the team member's end of year performance review.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Promote this team member to a coaching role after this project is completed.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The team member should negotiate the scope with the client.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should appreciate this team member's performance throughout the project life cycle. The project manager should provide constructive feedback to team members on a frequent basis. Team members need to know they are either on track or need to take steps to get back on track.

full-exam-2.Question: Your project team is making significant progress. You want to prepare work performance information and distribute it to the stakeholders so that they are aware of project progress. Which of the following can be included as work performance information?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Status of Deliverables
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Number of Defects
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Actual Costs
full-exam-2.Explanation: Work Performance Information. The performance data collected from various controlling processes analyzed in context and integrated based on relationships across areas. Examples of performance information are status of deliverables, implementation status for change requests, and forecast estimates to complete. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 26.

full-exam-2.Question: Your Agile team is collocated except one of the team members who is based at the client location. How should you conduct your daily standups with this constraint?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Conduct the face-to-face daily standups without the remotely located team member.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Use video conferencing technology to accommodate the remote team member.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Do not use daily standups and rely on formal written communications.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Since all of the team members are not collocated, this is not an Agile project. It is recommended reverting back to traditional project management approaches.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Although it is desirable that all team members are physically present during the daily standups, there are always some constraints that can create impediments. In this case, the remotely located team member should join the meeting using video conferencing technology. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 122.

full-exam-2.Question: A project team is currently building a warehouse management system. Due to the complexity of the project and ambiguous requirements, the team decided to adopt an Agile management approach. If a higher rate of management process improvement is required by the project team, which of the following can help achieve this objective?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Adopting XP for the development phase
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Frequent retrospectives and selecting improvements
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Using a Kanban board to enable visual management
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Deferring the development until all requirements have been collected
full-exam-2.Explanation: Deferring the development until the design is complete is a waterfall approach. Using a Kanban board can help managing the work, but frequent retrospectives can really facilitate process improvement by allowing the team to brainstorm on what went well and what went wrong. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 32.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager focuses on systems and structure to accomplish project goals. As a result, the project manager has a strained relationship with the project team. Although the current project is trending to meet project objectives, excessive turnover of the project team threatens the project. For self-improvement, what type of skills should the project manager spend time developing?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Communication Skills
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Leadership Skills
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Operational and Problem-Solving Skills
full-exam-2.Explanation: The strained relationship with the project team suggests that the project manager lacks in leadership skills to foster better relationships

full-exam-2.Question: During sprint execution, one of the developers requires clarification about the acceptance criteria for a particular task. What should the project manager do to obtain the information required by the developer?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Request support from the development manager.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Send an emaiI to the customer requesting clarification.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Request directions for the project sponsor.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Work with the product owner to clarify the requirements.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The product owner is responsible for defining and prioritizing the user stories in the product backlog. This should reflect highest business value (and risk) first, with lower value stories on the bottom. As the project progresses, the product owner continues to provide guidance to the team on the prioritization of the stories, defines acceptance criteria (often with the help of the teams), and accepts stories as they are completed and delivered.

full-exam-2.Question: You are managing the design and development of an HR system. Your project calls for communication in the form of announcements and complex information sets with an extremely large audience. What communication method would be appropriate under such circumstances?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Verbal Communication
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Push Communication
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Pull Communication
full-exam-2.Explanation: The situation in the project would call for pull communication. This is suitable for a large audience, and it allows them to access information at their own discretion. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 374.

full-exam-2.Question: Your organization has been awarded a contract to develop and implement a new resource management system for a client based in Asia. Your development team is distributed across Europe. You are also planned to relocate the implementation team to the client location. What would be your biggest challenge in such a setup?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Efficient and Effective Communication
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Controlling Project Costs
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Documenting Sprint Retrospectives
full-exam-2.Explanation: The most efficient and effective method of communication is face-to-face conversation. When a project has a virtual team, the biggest challenge is ensuring efficient and effective communications. None of the other choices are more significant than this. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 9.

full-exam-2.Question: Due to a recent technological development, a significant change in the product design is required. This change would require a 50% increase in the project budget. The project manager prepares a detailed report and emails it to the project sponsor, and the sponsor acknowledges the receipt of the report. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Update the project management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Wait for the formal approval of the new budget.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Update the cost baseline.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Acknowledgment of a message does not necessarily mean agreement with or comprehension of the message. The project manager should wait for formal approval of the budget before taking any action.

full-exam-2.Question: To create a quality product, the project management team invested in training the project team members and purchasing high-end equipment. Such costs are:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Appraisal Costs
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Prevention Costs
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Internal Failure Costs
full-exam-2.Explanation: Investments in training and equipment are examples of prevention costs. Appraisal costs include the testing, losses due to destructive testing, and inspections. Collectively, these costs are called Cost of Conformance.

full-exam-2.Question: You are creating your activity list, but only for the next two portions of the project. The rest of the work you are leaving at the work package level. What approach are you using?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Predictive Life Cycle
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Brainstorming
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Progressive Elaboration
full-exam-2.Explanation: Progressive elaboration is the iterative process of increasing the level of detail in a project management plan as greater amounts of information and more accurate estimates become available.

full-exam-2.Question: One developer's productivity is lacking compared with the others due to repetitive attendance issues. What should the project manager do to determine the appropriate disciplinary actions specific to this project?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Check the resource management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Review the stakeholder register.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Review the organizational process assets.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The resource management plan provides guidance on various aspects of team development including disciplinary actions as a result of team performance assessments. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 339.

full-exam-2.Question: In your project, a supplier delivers equipment that fails to meet customer requirements. After the investigation, you determined that the supplier misunderstood the requirements and make incorrect assumptions without clarifying them with the customer. As a project manager, what type of communication methods should you have used to avoid this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Manual Communication
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Pull Communication
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Push Communication
full-exam-2.Explanation: Interactive communication is the best communication method that can be used to avoid that the supplier misunderstood the requirements with the customer.

full-exam-2.Question: Before initiating any such project, the value of the project to the organization must be determined. Which of the following is the most critical factor to be considered in such a scenario?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Net Present Value (NPV) of the projects
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Internal Rate of Return (IRR) of the projects
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Alignment with the strategic goals
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Investment requirement
full-exam-2.Explanation: All projects must be aligned with the strategic goals of the organization.

full-exam-2.Question: While working on the layout of one of the screens on a mobile application, a developer on an agile team came up with a screen improvement idea that will increase the application's usability, and ultimately increase customer satisfaction. Implementing this idea represents a new requirement. The developer's first thought is to implement this improvement to impress their client. What should the developer do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Suggest this requirement to the product owner for possible inclusion in the next iteration.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Collect the supporting information for this requirement and present this information to the product owner.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Implement this requirement to show the product owner the improvement in terms of the application's usability.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Do nothing; since this requirement is out of scope and it should not be added to the product.
full-exam-2.Explanation: By suggesting to the product owner that this requirement be created as a new user story, the user story can be reviewed and considered for inclusion in the next iteration by the product owner and the customer.

full-exam-2.Question: A project's primary focus is staying on schedule. To monitor this, the project manager requests monthly progress reports from the contractor. What should the project manager ask the contractor to include in these reports?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Schedule Attributes
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Gantt Chart
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should ask the contractor to include in these reports the Gantt charts (also known as Bar Charts) because it represents schedule information where activities are listed on the vertical axis, dates are shown on the horizontal axis, and activity durations are shown as horizontal bars placed according to start and finish dates. Bar charts are relatively easy to read and are commonly used. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 217.

full-exam-2.Question: When grooming the backlog, which of the following is the greatest determinant for priority?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Dependencies
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Risk Mitigation
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Value
full-exam-2.Explanation: Value is the greatest determinant for priority. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 9.

full-exam-2.Question: You are always struggling with resource supply for your project because they are shared across various projects. To whom should you escalate this issue?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) The Organization's PMO
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The Procurement Manager
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The Sponsor
full-exam-2.Explanation: Shared resources are usually administered by the PMO. Note that portfolio management (not listed as an option) is responsible to ensure resource supply in an organization, therefore, will also prioritize and allocate (plan) overall resources. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 48.

full-exam-2.Question: A security team notifies a project manager of a change in security procedures. The project manager uses the change control process to update the project management plan. After seeing the change, a stakeholder complains that it was unnecessary because the project is almost complete. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Add a risk to the risk register to track the impact of stakeholder.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Convince the stakeholder the benefits from the resulting from the change.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Create a change request to reverse the change until a consensus is reached.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Ignore the stakeholder's concern and follow the new procedures.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager used the change control process to update the project management plan because it is a very important change and necessary for the project. The project manager with the team member have evaluated the impact of this change on project constraints and then it is approved by the CCB. Therefore, he should convince the stakeholder of the benefits resulting from the change. Option (Create a change request to reverse the change until a consensus is reached) is not good because the change is already approved after the consensus of CCB. Option (Ignore the stakeholder's concern and follow the new procedures) is not correct because it is not a good practice to ignore the stakeholder's requests. Option (Add a risk to the risk register to track the impact of stakeholder disagreement) is not correct because this not a risk and the change has been approved.

full-exam-2.Question: An architectural firm has spent a great deal of time and effort creating the design and blueprints for the building. They had to purchase materials and hire consultants and have been working on this project for 6 months. They have submitted all the invoices for the money they have spent on the work, as well as an invoice for the fee of $5,000. What type of contract was this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Cost-Reimbursable
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Cost Plus Incentive Fee (CPIF)
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Fixed Price with Economic Price Adjustments (FPEPA)
full-exam-2.Explanation: It is mentioned that payment was according to actual cost so, Options B and D are excluded. There is no evidence that the fee was calculated as percentage from the budget or based on performance. Therefore, cost plus incentive fee is also excluded. The right answer is A; as the contract is cost reimbursable in general.

full-exam-2.Question: You are managing a construction project. After identifying risks, you start the qualitative risk analysis process and now you are going to prioritize them. Which of the following techniques are you going to use?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Scatter Diagram
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Tornado Diagram
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Probability and Impact Matrix
full-exam-2.Explanation: After identifying risks, the next step will be to prioritize them. To do so, you will use the probability and impact matrix. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 408.

full-exam-2.Question: Agile approaches promise better user experience of project deliverables in comparison to the traditional waterfall-based approaches. This is due to:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Early and continual involvement of users
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Relying less on processes and more on documentation
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Relying less on processes and more on processes
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Early development of an exhaustive product backlog
full-exam-2.Explanation: Exhaustive product backlogs are not developed in Agile projects that would be a waterfall approach. Documentation and processes are both lesser valued than a working product. Agile approaches promise better user experience of project deliverables by early and continual involvement of users. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 58.

full-exam-2.Question: During the development phase of an IT implementation project, the client refuses to grant the project team access to their database. Since this is essential for the configuration of the application, the project deliverables could be impacted. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Log it in the risk register.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Discuss it with the project team and update the project schedule.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Update the issue log and meet with the client to review.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Review the project statement of work (SOW).
full-exam-2.Explanation: Since the client refuses to grant the project team access to their database, this is an issue and the project manager should FIRST update the issue log and meet with the client to review and solve it.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager is starting a new project and has identified an opportunity to use the iterative tools. One of the senior managers is concerned about this modified framework; as it is new to the company. What should the project manager do FIRST?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Organize individual sessions with the stakeholders to build awareness and trust in the new framework.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Look for external training on the new framework to eliminate the risk of low engagement from stakeholders.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Send documentation to the senior manager about the advantages of the new framework.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Escalate the senior manager's concern to the project sponsor and distribute the status to the team.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should organize individual sessions with the stakeholders to build awareness and trust in the new framework

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following BEST describes the role of a project sponsor?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Project sponsor is responsible for managing the project.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Project sponsor is responsible for managing the quality of deliverables.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Project sponsor is responsible for identifying key stakeholders.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Project sponsor is responsible for providing funding for the project.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project sponsor is not responsible for managing the project nor the quality of deliverables; it is the role of the project manager. While the sponsor can aid in identifying key stakeholders, the key area a sponsor plays a part in is providing funding. The sponsor provides funding directly or indirectly and is responsible for approving or denying the budget. The project sponsor is also generally the one who approves the project charter, but that is not mentioned in the question.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager is working with the team to develop a software application. Due to failures in similar application in the past, the rapid feedback from the customer on the suitability of the deliverables is very important. What is the BEST approach that should be selected?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Traditional
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Waterfall
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Predictive
full-exam-2.Explanation: An adaptive approach is a generic term for various project management approaches typically used on agile projects. This approach promotes the work to be undertaken in short cycles so that the results can be reviewed early and adapted as necessary. Of the choices provided, the adaptive approach is the only one that would provide rapid feedback on the suitability of the deliverables.

full-exam-2.Question: Owen has recently been assigned as the project manager for a new shopping mall construction project. He suspects that there are materials in the building that may be a serious health hazard. What should Owen do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Hire a hazardous materials expert to investigate.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Assess the risk and update the risk register.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Perform integrated change control.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Implement the risk response plan.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The first step is that you should hire a hazardous expert to carry out inspection. The project manager can stop the work immediately if the scenario mentioned (sure) not (suspect).

full-exam-2.Question: An internal stakeholder is annoyed that he was not included before the project began. The stakeholder is asking for an addition to the requirements traceability matrix. As a project manager, what should you do to improve the stakeholder relationship?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Engage the stakeholder to solicit more information.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Review the project scope document to make sure the addition is in scope.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Update the stakeholder engagement plan to ensure that the stakeholder is included in the project stakeholder list.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Issue a change request to the CCB.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should identify the stakeholder first. Therefore, he should engage the stakeholder to solicit more information and update the stakeholder register. Option (Update the stakeholder engagement plan to ensure that the stakeholder is included in the project stakeholder list) is not correct because the plan is not including the stakeholder list. Option (Issue a change request to the CCB) is not correct because updating the stakeholder register does not need approved change request; it is a living document.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager feels the need of updating one of the project supplier contracts to meet the current needs of the project. However, before any change can be requested, the project manager must know the right process to incorporate a change to this specific contract. What should he do FIRST?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Update the project procurement management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Review alternative dispute resolution (ADR) procedures in the contract.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Issue the change request and get it approved through integrated change control process.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Review the change control procedure as documented in the contract.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The first step should be to gather enough information so that the right decision and course of action can be determined. The second step should be to issue a change request and follow its approval. The project manager must first review the change control procedure specific to the contract and that can be found in the procurement contract itself. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 489.

full-exam-2.Question: You are managing an e-commerce-enabled website. You have recommended the Agile project management approach to the client and they are happy with any management approach as long as they receive a working product. You and your team have a tough decision to make regarding sprint durations. A sprint duration of two weeks would add a lot of pressure on the team as complex requirements will be tough to build in a single sprint. A sprint duration of six weeks would make the project less Agile, but the project might get finished early as the customer will not get to see many prototypes. What sprint size should be selected?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Four weeks should be selected; as that is the average of two numbers.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Six weeks should be selected; as the project would get finished early and satisfy the customer.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Two weeks should be selected; as Agile Manifesto mandates frequent delivery of working software.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) A sprint size needs to be determined that maximizes customer value and satisfaction.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The highest priority is to satisfy the customer through early and continuous delivery of valuable software. A sprint size needs to be determined that maximizes customer value and satisfaction. More information would be required to determine the best duration. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 9.

full-exam-2.Question: After conducting data analysis, a project manager determines the cause and degree of variance relatives to the approved scope. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Decide if a corrective or preventative action is required.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Updates the scope management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Change the performance measurement baseline.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Revise the scope baseline.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Important aspects of project scope control include determining the cause and degree of variance relative to the scope baseline and deciding whether corrective or preventive action is required. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 170.

full-exam-2.Question: Sandy is a project manager who has been assigned to manage a new project. The project needs resources with specific skills from various organization departments. She must identify and agree on available internal human resources, and hire external experts because most organization staff are already assigned to other projects. What should Sandy use FIRST to obtain resources?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Negotiation Skills
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Resource Traceability Matrix
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Interpersonal and Team Assessment Tools
full-exam-2.Explanation: An interpersonal and team skill that can be used for Acquire Resources process is negotiation. Many projects need to negotiate for required resources. The project manager needs to negotiate with: * Functional managers, ensure that the project receives the best resources possible in the required timeframe and until their responsibilities are complete. **Other project management teams within the performing organization. Appropriately assign or share scarce or specialized resources. ***External organizations and suppliers. Provide appropriate, scarce, specialized, qualified, certified, or other specific team or physical resources. Special consideration should be given to external negotiating policies, practices, processes, guidelines, legal, and other such criteria. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 332.

full-exam-2.Question: You are managing an agile software project. Previously, you had managed only non-Agile projects. Which type of meetings would you find to be unique to your current project compared to your earlier projects?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Sprint Meetings
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Vendor Performance Review Meetings
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Quality Review Meetings
full-exam-2.Explanation: Sprint meetings are unique to agile projects.

full-exam-2.Question: You have been assigned a new project. The project involves disruptive technologies. The project scope is not clear which has introduced a lot of risk into the project. You have requested to use Agile to manage this project. Why?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Agile techniques and approaches effectively manage scope changes.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Agile techniques and approaches effectively manage disruptive technologies, scope changes, and project risk.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Agile techniques and approaches effectively manage disruptive technologies.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Agile techniques and approaches effectively manage project risk.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Agile techniques and approaches effectively manage disruptive technologies, scope changes, and project risk. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 2.

full-exam-2.Question: As a project manager, you are estimating the duration of your project activities using a triangular distribution formula. For a particular project activity, your optimistic estimate is 14 days, the pessimistic estimate is 49 days, and the most likely estimate is 27 days. What should be the expected duration of this activity?
full-exam-2.Explanation: Triangular distribution allows the estimator to include three estimates: optimistic, pessimistic, and most likely. The expected duration is calculated using the equation: Expected Duration = [P + ML + 01/3, where P is the pessimistic estimate, ML is the most likely estimate, and 0 is the optimistic estimate. Using this method, the correct answer: 14+49+27/3=30 days.

full-exam-2.Question: Two of your team members have come to you due to a difference of opinion between them. What is the BEST way to resolve this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) When one of them backs out due to frustration.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) By understanding the needs of both and guiding them to successful resolution and their full satisfaction.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) By providing your opinion of who is right.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) When one of them is very flexible to accept the other person's opinion in front of you.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The approach should be of problem solving or collaboration.

full-exam-2.Question: The business is unclear on the direction and when features are to be expected for an agile managed project. What project artifact helps communicate the goals, milestones, and potential deliverables, releases, or other work outputs?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Requirements Documentation
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Project Charter
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Configuration Management Plan
full-exam-2.Explanation: Product roadmap. A high-level visual summary of the product or products of the project that includes goals, milestones, and potential deliverables.

full-exam-2.Question: You are monitoring the status of a project to update the project progress and manage changes to the schedule baseline. You have some resources assigned to more than one activity simultaneously, making them over-allocated during those days. You want to reduce this over-allocation and keep resource usage at a constant level. What technique should you use to achieve this goal?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Schedule Compression
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Resource Compression
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Resource De-allocation
full-exam-2.Explanation: Resource leveling is used to reduce overall location and to keep resource usage at a constant level. This technique can be used in both the develop schedule process and the control schedule process.

full-exam-2.Question: After several iterations, some of the stakeholders from your software development project have begun to raise concerns about the product your team has developed so far. The stakeholders claim the product is not what they had envisioned at the beginning of the project when you interviewed them as part of the collect requirements process. What did you likely miss earlier?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Creating a detailed WBS during project initiation
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Planning a response to the risk of building a wrong product
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Conducting targeted brainstorming sessions
full-exam-2.Explanation: Prototyping is a method of obtaining early feedback and stakeholder buy-in on requirements by providing a model of the expected product before actually building its final version. Prototypes are widely used in projects where products are developed incrementally, as in the scenario provided. It is likely that if the team created adequate prototypes, the situation described in the scenario could have been avoided. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 147.

full-exam-2.Question: The project team members are in conflict, not collaborative, and differ in opinion on the architecture. Which of the following phases of development are they in now?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Performing
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Forming
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Norming
full-exam-2.Explanation: There are five stages of Team Development: Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing, and Adjourning. In the Storming phase, the team is in conflict; as they begin to address the project work, technical work, and project management approach. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 338.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager is leading a project to design and develop a new cutting edge computer system, which is in the second of 5 phases. The project is running behind schedule and significantly over budget due to a force majeure. The project is being conducted internally to maintain control over the proprietary technology which will provide a competitive advantage. The project has reached a phase gate. What is the purpose of performing the phase gate?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Determine how many resources are required to complete the project according to the project baseline.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Adjust the schedule and cost baselines based on past performance.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The project's performance is compared to the business documents to determine if the project should continue to the next phase, end the project, or repeat the phase.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Obtain customer acceptance of project deliverables.
full-exam-2.Explanation: A phase gate is a review point at the end of a phase to determine if the project will continue to the succeeding phase, end the project, repeat the phase, or continue with some modifications. The business documents and project charter are needed to determine whether or not the project should progress to the next phase. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 21.

full-exam-2.Question: In one of the meetings, the project sponsor shouted at the project manager that why did she send the critical reports to the HR manager. What could have been done to prevent this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Review Organizational Process Assets
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Review Communication Management Plan
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Review Stakeholder Engagement Plan
full-exam-2.Explanation: He should have reviewed the communication management plan; as it contains the following: • who needs what information, and who is authorized to access that information; • When they will need the information; • Where the information should be stored; • what format the information should be stored in; • How the information can be retrieved. The communications management plan documents how the communication needs of the stakeholders will be met, including the types of information that will be communicated, who will communicate it, who receives the communication, the methods used to communicate, the timing and frequency, the method for updating this plan as the project progresses, the escalation process, and a glossary of common terms. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 377.

full-exam-2.Question: Your organization's PMO is periodically asking for project artifacts from all projects and checking whether corporate standards of project management are being adhered to or not. They are also supportive in providing templates and guidelines related to project management when asked. Which type of PMO are we referring to here?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Supporting PMO
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Controlling PMO
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Governing PMO
full-exam-2.Explanation: Though the PMO is assisting with templates and guidelines like a supportive PMO, they are playing the bigger role of a controlling PMO here.

full-exam-2.Question: In addition to the departments listed in the scenario, your company also has a manager of project management to oversee all of the ongoing projects. As one of the project managers, you report directly to the project management department but share staff with other departments. What type of organizational structure does this describe?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Projectized
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Composite
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Matrix
full-exam-2.Explanation: In matrix organizations, there are two managers. Power is shared between the project manager and functional manager.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following processes must the project manager perform to avoid scope creep caused by uncontrolled changes?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Control Quality Process
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Perform Integrated Change Control Process
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis Process
full-exam-2.Explanation: The uncontrolled expansion to product or project scope without adjustments to time, cost, and resources is referred to as scope creep. Change is inevitable so, the project manager must perform all changes through the Integrated Change Control process to avoid scope creep caused by uncontrolled changes.

full-exam-2.Question: You are leading a software development project, which requires knowledge of several programming languages. During project execution, one of the developers has been pulled out of the project by his functional manager. The manager provided you with another developer instead. What should you do FIRST?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Introduce the new developer to the project sponsor.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Schedule training for the new developer.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Assign the developer the next user story in the backlog.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Provide the new developer with an ability test.
full-exam-2.Explanation: An ability test would provide an assessment of the new developer's existing competencies in order to determine what, if any, gaps in skill set exist and how they might be addressed.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager in a project to build a concrete waterfall at a theme park. You like to plan everything upfront and follow the waterfall method. However, the customer does not want everything fixed from the beginning; as he may change his mind in a number of areas once the project is underway, and needs to be sure that you can allow for flow-on effects. What sort of project life cycle should you use?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Adaptive
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Predictive
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Tacit
full-exam-2.Explanation: The answer is Adaptive. "In an adaptive or agile life cycle, the deliverables are developed over multiple iterations where a detailed scope is defined and approved for each iteration when it begins". PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 131.

full-exam-2.Question: You are leading a massive knowledge work project. Some team members have complained that they have to work overtime in order to complete some of the assigned work. What should you do to resolve this issue?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Launch a root cause analysis.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Establish a Kanban board and set WIP limits.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Establish working agreements.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Call a team for a retrospective meeting.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The problem is in unmanageable WIP. The solution is to limit the WIP based on team capacity. A Kanban board can be really helpful in setting this up. A Kanban board provides a means to visualize the flow of work, make impediments easily visible, and allow flow to be managed by adjusting the work in process limits. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 31.

full-exam-2.Question: The PMO has been following a waterfall-based project management approach consistently across all projects. You, as a project manager, want to pilot Agile approaches on a couple of new projects and see how these approaches can benefit the organization. However, the team members are not experienced in the use of Agile approaches. What should you do FIRST?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Train the team members in effectively using the XP approach.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Train the team members in the fundamentals of the Agile Mindset and principles.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Train the team members in effectively using the Kanban approach.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Train the team members in effectively using the Scrum methodology.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Consider starting by training team members in the fundamentals of the Agile Mindset and principles. If the team decides to use a specific approach such as Scrum or Kanban, provide a workshop on that approach so that team members can learn how to use it. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 32.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager in a software project. A development team completed the project and plans to initiate the closure phase. However, one key stakeholder refuses to sign-off due to non-compliance with the agreed-upon deliverables. What should the project manager do to facilitate acceptance?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Conduct a variance analysis to identify any deviation in the deliverables.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Provide a new statement of work (SOW) for the variation in the deliverables.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Document the noncompliance and start the change management process.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Record the noncompliance and initiate project closure.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Variance analysis is a T&T in the Close Project or Phase process. First, the project manager should conduct a variance analysis to identify any deviation in the deliverables by comparing what was initially planned and the end result. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 126.

full-exam-2.Question: There is disagreement among the project stakeholders that makes the project manager having difficulty obtaining approval of the project requirements. As a project manager, what should you do FIRST to facilitate the approval of project requirements?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Team Building Activities
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Conduct a Stakeholder Analysis.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Identify the Source of the Disagreement.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should first identify the source of the disagreement to facilitate the approval of a project requirements.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager working with a risk-z has just started a new project. The project sponsor is extremely concerned that the project may run over budget and is looking to the project manager for confirmation that this will not happen. In order to alleviate the sponsor's concerns, what should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Perform a strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats (SWOT) analysis.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Run a monte carlo simulation.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Create the probability and impact matrix.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should first identify the risk and update the risk register then analyze the risk. SWOT analysis is one of the T&T in identify risk process to identify the strengths and weaknesses of the organization, focusing on either the project, organization, or the business area in general. SWOT analysis then identifies any opportunities for the project that may arise from strengths, and any threats resulting from weaknesses. The analysis also examines the degree to which organizational strengths may offset threats and determines if weaknesses might hinder opportunities. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 415.

full-exam-2.Question: You have been asked to develop a new website for one of your clients. The website is required to be browser independent and delivered within a month. Although the website has a simple design, the requirement of browser independence has added some complexity to the project. Which of the following approaches would you recommend for this project?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Predictive
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Incremental
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Agile
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project requires a single final delivery. However, project work might require repetitions until all browsers are supported. An iterative approach is ideal in this situation. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 19.

full-exam-2.Question: During a sprint review, the product owner rejects a deliverable stating that it does not meet the acceptance criteria. The quality assurance team, who verified the deliverable as part of the control quality process, argues that there is nothing wrong with the deliverable and that it should be accepted. The product owner disagrees and rejects the deliverable. What is the project manager's BEST course of action to ensure that this type of misunderstanding does not recur?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Submit a change request to modify the control quality process based on the recommendations from the team and product owner.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Discuss the problem during the next daily scrum meeting and resolve the misunderstanding between the product owner and team.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) At the upcoming sprint retrospective meeting, facilitate an exercise to identify the underlying cause of the misunderstanding.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Fire the team member who causes the issue.
full-exam-2.Explanation: This answer choice describes root cause analysis, which is a technique that can be used to identify the underlying reason for the misunderstanding. Once the root cause(s) of the misunderstanding is(are) removed, the problem should not recur. The upcoming sprint retrospective meeting is the most appropriate forum for such a discussion.

full-exam-2.Question: A stakeholder has been promoted to lead another functional area, but he is still a stakeholder in the project. To ensure good communication with him, what should be updated?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Stakeholder Engagement Plan
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Communication Management Plan
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Stakeholder Register
full-exam-2.Explanation: The stakeholder register lists all stakeholders with detailed information such as identification information and assessment information.

full-exam-2.Question: A software vendor has recently hired you to manage some of its key projects. During your orientation at the organization, you were told that the organization has recently adopted Agile practices for project management. A chart was then shown to you where Agile and Kanban were shown as a subset of Lean. What is your view on this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Agile and Kanban are subsets of Lean because they are named instances of Lean thinking.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) The chart is wrong because Agile is a subset of Lean while kanban is not.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The chart is wrong because Kanban is a subset of Lean while Agile is not.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The chart is wrong because Agile, Kanban, and Lean are three different approaches to project management.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Agile and Kanban are subsets of Lean because they are named instances of Lean thinking that share Lean concepts such as "focus on value", "small batch sizes", and "elimination of waste". Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 11.

full-exam-2.Question: The project team is reviewing the requirements documentation that they are responsible for working on. Which project artifact can they reference to see the connection between the requirements and the business and project objectives?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Project Charter
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Scope Management Plan
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) RACI Chart
full-exam-2.Explanation: The requirements traceability matrix is a grid that links product requirements from their origin to the deliverables that satisfy them. The implementation of a requirements traceability matrix helps ensure that each requirement adds business value by linking it to the business and project objectives.

full-exam-2.Question: Your project expense has increased in the last quarter due to the required office space for personnel and some of their travel. What can you do from a resource management planning perspective to address this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Bring all project team members to work from one location.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Use video conferencing and web-based settings.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Plan to incorporate a virtual team environment, if not done already.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Reduce the travel and office equipment cost.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Virtual team environment helps to move forward with projects that would have been canceled due to travel expenses and save expenses of the office and physical equipment for employees. In this arrangement, project team members need not work face to face, and facilities like video conferencing may be used. Bringing all team members into one location incurs more expenses due to relocation and possible higher office rates at that location. The option to reduce office and travel cost does not exactly specify how to reduce it. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 333.

full-exam-2.Question: A project team is analyzing a major, critical defect to determine the root cause. In order to do this, the team considered various factors linked to the defect and grouped them into categories such as Machine, Method, Material, and Manpower. Which of the following tools of quality is the team using?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Control Chart
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Cause-and-Effect Diagram
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Flowchart
full-exam-2.Explanation: Cause-and-effect diagrams are also known as fishbone diagrams, why-why diagrams, or Ishikawa diagrams. This type of diagram breaks down the causes of the problem statement identified into discrete branches, helping to determine the main or root cause of the problem. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 293.

full-exam-2.Question: During the execution of a project, the project manager discovers that one branch team's tasks are being ineffectively influenced by one team member. What should a project manager use to ensure good working relationships among team members?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Recognition and Rewards
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Ground Rules
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Team-building Activities
full-exam-2.Explanation: The objective of team-building activities is to help individual team members work together effectively. Team-building strategies are particularly valuable when team members operate from remote locations without the benefit of face-to-face contact. Informal communication and activities can help in building trust and establishing good working relationships. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 341.

full-exam-2.Question: Robert has just taken over a construction project. The project is currently in the planning phase of the project lifecycle. He realizes that a stakeholder engagement approach will not be sufficient. One of the client representatives, who is not a key decision-maker, is extremely intolerant. This client representative could become a roadblock to progress due to their perceived level of authority during meetings. How should Robert handle this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Update the risk register to consider the possible project impacts.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Allocate time to gain buy in from stakeholder prior to key decision meetings.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Ask that only key decision makers attend the project meeting.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Update the project schedule to cater to this particular stakeholder.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Stakeholder buy-in, the cooperation, or positive participation of a stakeholder is the preferred condition for any successful project. The project manager should allocate time to gain buy-in from the stakeholder prior to key decision meetings.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager of a software project. You work with a global virtual team. The team is facing difficulty in communicating with each other and often misses important messages. This difficulty leads to missed deadlines. What should you do to enhance project team effectiveness?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Initiate daily communication of project progress.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Identify the root cause of communication issues.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Implement team colocation to improve communication.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Schedule a communication control board meeting.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The root cause of the communication issue is known because you are working with a global virtual team and the team is located in different places. To enhance project team effectiveness, you should implement team colocation to improve communication.

full-exam-2.Question: Minor impediments may interfere with or slow down day-to-day progress. Which tool or practice can be used to bring attention to those impediments on a regular basis?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Daily Standups
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Kanban Boards
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Annual Conferences
full-exam-2.Explanation: Teams use standups to micro-commit to each other, uncover problems, and ensure the work flows smoothly through the team.

full-exam-2.Question: During project closure and transferring of the completed project deliverables to the operations group, the project manager discovers that an audit report from an early project phase is missing. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Ask the operations group to accept the project without the audit report.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Inform the operations group about the missing audit report.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Remove the audit report from the required project documents and update the project management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Complete project closure and Update the OPA.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Ethically, the project manager must inform the operations group about the missing audit report.

full-exam-2.Question: A company's PMO has been trying to implement an adaptive approach and a project manager has been asked to use adaptive tools in their next project. This is not the first time the request has been made, and the previous project failed when adaptive tools were implemented. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Conduct individual interviews with key stakeholders in order to understand all concerns then prepare a communication management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Prepare a change request and seek approval from the steering committee regarding the new project framework.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Recommend to the PMO that it is not the right time to start implementing adaptive tools in projects.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Bring third-party company to develop and implement a hybrid framework for this specific project.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The previous project failed when adaptive tools were implemented. The project manager should bring a third-party company to develop and implement a hybrid framework for this specific project.

full-exam-2.Question: When can the contract closeout occur?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Whenever a contract is completed and accepted.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) At the end of a project only unless the project is terminated early.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) At the end of a project only.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Whenever a seller is selected.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The contract closeout occurs whenever a contract is completed and accepted.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following describes the most common phase-to-phase relationship in multi-phase projects?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Orderly
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Non-overlapping
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Sequential
full-exam-2.Explanation: The phases may be sequential, iterative, or overlapping. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 19.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager for a maintenance project. The contract is renewed annually. The project started 5 years ago. After contract renewal this year, the auditor reported that this version of the contract violates a new law that was passed last year. What has happened in this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) The project manager does not have enough knowledge on this legal matter.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) The stakeholder engagement plan has not been correctly implemented.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The contract has not been appropriately reviewed by the project team.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The legal department has not disseminated the law correctly to all staff.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager does not have to be a trained expert in procurement management laws and regulations. The legal department is responsible for disseminating the law correctly to all staff.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager joins a project during its initial planning phase. The project involves various local government institutions. While interviewing the project sponsor, the project manager learns of the importance of keeping the security officers of two of these institutions satisfied; since project development will be affected without their involvement. What should the project manager use to record and monitor this information?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Communication Management Plan
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Power/Interest Grid
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Responsibility Assignment Matrix (RAM)
full-exam-2.Explanation: Power/interest grid supports a grouping of stakeholders according to their level of authority (power), level of concern about the project's outcomes (interest).

full-exam-2.Question: The government sponsors a project to construct a new highway. The assigned project manager communicates to stakeholders that the project charter was approved. The project manager is working on the project management plan and receives an email from an environmental organization asking for the objectives and start date of the project. What should the project manager do to address the situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Respond to the email with the requested information.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Conduct a brainstorming session with the stakeholders and the team.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Update the communication management plan accordingly.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Conduct a stakeholder analysis and communicate stakeholders accordingly.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Since the project is in the planning phase and the environmental organization did not identify before, the project manager should first conduct a stakeholder analysis to learn about their major requirements, expectations, and the potential for influencing project outcomes and communicate to stakeholders accordingly.

full-exam-2.Question: As a project manager for a large construction project, the project management plan states that it is necessary to contract a highly trained external resource to revise and validate an important project component. The client has rejected hiring the external resource because of the high cost even though it is within the project budget. What should you do to resolve this issue?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Try to accomplish the task internally by leveling resources from other projects.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Evaluate the consequences and meet with the client to explain the possible scenarios.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Ask the client for a meeting and explain that the tasks will not be performed.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Hire the resource in order to achieve the project objectives.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should first evaluate the consequences, then meet with the client to explain the possible scenarios.

full-exam-2.Question: Using the following values, calculate the management reserve: project budget = 100,000, EAC = 120,000, AC = 5,500, and BAC=70,000
full-exam-2.Explanation: The Management reserve = Project Budget - BAC. Therefore, 100,000-70,000=30,000. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 264.

full-exam-2.Question: During the demo of an agile project, the client states that the product does not reflect the product vision and requirements initially discussed. The client says that the product needs significant changes before it would be acceptable. What might have prevented this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Allowing higher transparency of the work in front of the stakeholders.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Isolating the development team from stakeholders to avoid distraction.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Following a more rigorous organization's change control process.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Managing conflicts more efficiently between the client and the team.
full-exam-2.Explanation: To accelerate the sharing of information among stakeholders, agile methods promote aggressive transparency. For example, agile encourages inviting any stakeholders (which would include the client) to project meetings and reviews to surface as quickly as possible any misalignment, dependency, or other issue related to the changing project. Also, many agile teams post information radiators (project status and progress artifacts) in public spaces for everybody to view.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following does the Agile teams use to collaboratively prioritize user stories based on their respective value to the project's customer?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Conducting Sprint Retrospectives
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Rolling Wave Planning
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Kanban Board
full-exam-2.Explanation: Backlog grooming, also known as backlog refining, involves adding, removing, and prioritizing stories in the product backlog. The purpose of refinement is to help the team understand what the stories are and how large the stories are in relation to each other. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 52.

full-exam-2.Question: You administer surveys, interviews, assessments, and focus groups within your project team and create a team performance assessment with observations on their skills, competencies, turnover rate, and cohesiveness. You then evaluate the team's overall performance. How will you use this report now?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Make changes to the team members who are performing poorly.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Identify specific training, coaching, mentoring, or other changes required to improve the team's performance.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Estimate the revised project schedule based on the team's performance.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Estimate the cost of improving the team's performance.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The team performance assessment is used to identify performance improvement strategies and actions. Though at some point this may include changing team members, or reviewing impact to project schedule or estimating training costs, the first step is to identify actions to be undertaken specifically with respect to team performance improvement. Also, team members cannot be changed without giving them the opportunity to improve first.

full-exam-2.Question: You are planning for project resources and have created a table showing individual roles for various tasks in the project. What sort of representation is this called, from a resource planning perspective?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) An OBS
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) A RACI Chart
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) A Text-Based Format of an Organization Chart
full-exam-2.Explanation: A RACI chart (a type of responsibility assignment matrix) arranges individuals and their roles for various tasks in the project. R = responsible, A = accountable, C = consult, I = inform.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following techniques is the MOST effective form of conflict resolution in a project?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Reconciling
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Collaborating
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Smoothing
full-exam-2.Explanation: Collaborating (or Problem Solving) is a conflict resolution technique that incorporates multiple viewpoints, requires a cooperative attitude and open dialogue, and that typically leads to consensus and commitment concerning how to resolve the conflict.

full-exam-2.Question: You are helping a software development team transition from traditional to Agile approaches. You tell the team that the single most important attribute of any product or feature is:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) The velocity at which the team takes on the development of that product or feature
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) The value customers associate with that product or feature
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The time required to deliver the product or feature
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The ideal days estimated to develop the minimum viable product or feature
full-exam-2.Explanation: A successful project, product, or feature is the one that delivers value to the customer. Customers usually do not care how teams develop products, however they do care if the product delivers value to them or not. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 4.

full-exam-2.Question: If the project was terminated early, why would the project manager insist that the team perform the close project or phase process?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) To document lessons learned so mistakes will not be repeated in future projects.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) To document the reasons why the project was terminated early and how to transfer the finished and unfinished deliverables to others.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) The project manager should insist this is a waste of the team members' time; since no one wants the project or its output any longer.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) To make sure that everyone knows that the reason for project termination was his fault or the fault of the team.
full-exam-2.Explanation: When the project is terminated early, the project manager should direct the team to document the reasons why the project was terminated early, and how to transfer the finished and unfinished deliverables to others.

full-exam-2.Question: A scrum master is leading an agile project in which the development team has failed to achieve the sprint goal for the past 3 iterations. During the sprint retrospective, the team decides to implement several changes to improve velocity. How might the scrum master verify any performance improvement?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Review the burnup chart.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Create Pareto chart.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Study the Gantt chart.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Burnup chart is used to find the amount of work completed over time. A burnup chart is a graphical representation of the work completed toward the release of a product. The burnup chart would reveal the development teams’ productivity over time.

full-exam-2.Question: Lucy is a project manager who is starting a project using a hybrid approach. She notices that some team members only have knowledge of predictive approaches. What does Lucy need to do FIRST in order to have good project performance?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Assess the required training per team member.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Coach those team members lacking hybrid knowledge.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Replace the team with hybrid approach experts.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Deliver hybrid training to all team members.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Always coaching the team should be before the training. As a servant leader, you should coach those team members lacking hybrid knowledge. Coaching is the main responsibility of the servant leader. Option (Deliver hybrid training to all team members) is not correct because not all team members need training.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following interpersonal and team skills helps to reduce misunderstandings and improves communication and knowledge sharing?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Political Awareness
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Leadership
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Active Listening
full-exam-2.Explanation: Active listening helps reduce misunderstandings and improves communication and knowledge sharing. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 140.

full-exam-2.Question: An agile project is running its 5th iteration out of 8. A stakeholder is not happy with the progress the team made so far. The stakeholder approaches the team and requests that from now on, the team informs him about the status of their work on an ongoing basis. How should a servant leader respond?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Explain to the stakeholder that agile projects discourage progress monitoring.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Provide the stakeholder with the performance measurement baseline.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Suggest that the stakeholder periodically reviews the information radiators.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Invite the stakeholder to the daily standups, iteration reviews, and retrospectives.
full-exam-2.Explanation: An information radiator is a visible, physical (or electronic) display that provides project information to the stakeholders enabling up-to-the-minute knowledge sharing without having to disturb the project team. In the reference provided, one of the agile manifesto authors says that an information radiator "displays information in a place where passerby can see it. With information radiators, the passerby does not need to ask questions; the information simply hits them as they pass by." In the scenario provided, an information radiator, such as a kanban board and/or a burndown chart, can allow the stakeholder to monitor the progress of the user stories being developed by the team. Kanban board can display work in progress at each stage of development. A burndown chart allows seeing how much work remained to be completed in a release or an iteration. Of the choices provided, suggesting that the stakeholder periodically reviews the information radiators would address the stakeholder's request to monitor the status of the team's work on an ongoing basis and is, therefore, the best answer to the question asked.

full-exam-2.Question: Early in the establishment of the project, the project manager spends time looking for historical data that might be helpful in planning the new project. He is looking for examples of project documents in similar projects that have been completed that he might be able to use as templates for the new project. He is also looking for information about established processes and procedures that will help the project run more smoothly. What is the term used to define these?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Progressive Elaboration
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Retrospective
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Organizational Process Assets (OPAs)
full-exam-2.Explanation: Templates, processes, and procedures are an example of organizational process assets (OPAs).

full-exam-2.Question: After a high-level management meeting, the manager chairing the meeting asks the project manager to document and communicate the action items to all the stakeholders. The project manager is part of which type of organization?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Tight Matrix
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Balanced Matrix
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Weak Matrix
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager is part of a weak matrix organization and is playing the role of project expeditor. The project expeditor acts primarily as a staff assistant and communication coordinator. The expeditor personally cannot make or enforce decisions.

full-exam-2.Question: You have been invited by your colleague to attend one of the project standup meetings. You notice that the team has got a big chart on a wall, divided into sections such as "Ready", "In Development", "Being Tested", and "Completed". What tool are they using?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Kanban Board
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Burndown Chart
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) War Room
full-exam-2.Explanation: This is an example of Kanban board. A Kanban board provides a means to visualize the flow of work, make impediments easily visible, and allow flow to be managed by adjusting the work in process limits. [Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 31.

full-exam-2.Question: Before disbanding a project team, the project manager facilitates a lessons learned workshop. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Send project documents to the stakeholders.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Review the issue log and update if necessary to minimize the impact on the project.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Organize a party to celebrate the project success.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Archive project documents using generally accepted practices.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Archive project documents using generally accepted practices.

full-exam-2.Question: A project is 6 months into its 9-month projected duration, and the project manager is reporting that the project is at least 3 months behind schedule because certain key stakeholders were resistant to any changes that might occur as outcomes of the project. What might have been done differently during project planning to avoid this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Establishment of a more robust communications management plan
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Creation of a comprehensive stakeholder register
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Better execution of the manage stakeholder engagement process
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Development of a stakeholder engagement assessment matrix
full-exam-2.Explanation: The scenario describes a situation where the resistance of certain key stakeholders has caused the project to run behind schedule and is asking what might have been done differently during project planning.
