Two of the answer choices represent activities which are not associated with the planning process group, and, as a result, those responses can be eliminated. Both of the remaining answer choices represent reasonable actions that may have led to better stakeholder engagement. The development of the stakeholder engagement assessment matrix directly addresses the issue described by the question. The stakeholder engagement assessment matrix is used as a tool during the plan stakeholder engagement process and identifies key stakeholders along with their current and desired engagement level. Classifications for stakeholder engagement may include unaware, resistant, neutral, supportive, and leading. In this scenario, certain key stakeholders were resistant to the project which caused the project to run behind schedule. A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix is the best tool for identifying resistant stakeholders with enough influence to undermine a project. In this case, identifying the current and desired engagement levels of the key stakeholders might have allowed the project manager to take action to address the undesirable engagement levels and prevent the stakeholder's resistance from negatively impact the project's performance. Therefore, of the available options, development of a stakeholder engagement assessment matrix is the best answer to the question asked.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following statements most accurately describes a typical project scenario?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Changes in project scope during the initial phases of the project are very expensive.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) The influence of the stakeholders is the same all through the project.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Staffing peaks during the execution phase of a project.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) The next phase of a project should never start until the deliverables for the previous phase are completely reviewed and approved.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Staffing is typically highest during the execution phase of the project. The other three responses may not hold true. Projects can move forward into subsequent phases without the deliverables of the prior phase being completely approved; this is known as fast tracking. Changes during the initial phases of the project are the least expensive. The influence of the stakeholders is highest during the start of the project and declines as the project moves to completion. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 549.

full-exam-2.Question: Responding to change over following a plan is one of the key Agile Manifesto values. Which of the following Agile approaches helps in achieving this value?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) SeIf-organizing Teams
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Kanban Boards
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Backlog Refinement
full-exam-2.Explanation: Backlog refinement allows the product owner to change project priorities in line with evolving business needs. This changes the focus from following a predefined plan to responding to change. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 97.

full-exam-2.Question: Every time-boxed iteration in the project has a demo scheduled at the end during the iteration review session. What is the goal of this demo?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) To revise the product roadmap.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) To groom the iteration backlog.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) To solicit feedback from the product owner and other stakeholders.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) To establish the features to be included in the product backlog.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The iteration review session: • Hosted at the end of every sprint • Attendees will be the development team, the product owner, scrum master, and sometimes other project stakeholders • Development team will demo the work created in the increment • The group will decide if "Done" has been achieved • The development team and the product owner will discuss the sprint and the remaining items in the product backlog.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager in a critical project for your organization. Your project sponsor has asked you to finish the project early as soon as possible. As a project manager, to motivate your project team, which of the following will you use?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Reschedule baselines to finish the project early
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Recognition and rewards system
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Perform quality assurance
full-exam-2.Explanation: As a project manager, to motivate your project team to finish the project early, you should conduct the recognition and rewards system

full-exam-2.Question: Because of the complexity and the number of requirements, you need someone to provide the guiding direction and requirements prioritization. Ideally, this role should work with the project team and provide product feedback, and set direction on the next piece of functionality to be delivered. In Agile, this role is called:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Scrum Master
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Servant-Leader
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Cross-Functional Team Member
full-exam-2.Explanation: The product owner is responsible for guiding the direction of the product. Product owners rank the work based on its business value. Product owners work with their teams by providing product feedback and setting direction on the next piece of functionality to be delivered. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 41.

full-exam-2.Question: Several team members seem disinterested in the daily standup meeting and are carrying on a side conversation. What should the agile coach do first?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Let the team uphold its own ground rules.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Ignore the issue and let the meeting continue.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Inform their functional managers after the meeting.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Stop the meeting and dismiss the participants.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Agile teams are self-directing, self-organizing, self-managing, and empowered to make decisions related to the way they work together toward the completion of the project goals.

full-exam-2.Question: When a project manager assumes the role of a coach and a facilitator for the project team in an Agile environment, this role is known as:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Servant-Leader
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Functional Manager
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Project Sponsor
full-exam-2.Explanation: In an Agile environment, project managers are servant-leaders, changing their emphasis to coaching people who want help, fostering greater collaboration on the team, and aligning stakeholder needs. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 38.

full-exam-2.Question: You and your team are executing the first Agile project in the organization. This is a special project for the organization; as Agile is being piloted for the first time. You are nearing the end of the first iteration on the project and not all of the assigned user stories are complete. Can the team extend the iteration duration by a couple of days in order to complete all assigned stories in the iteration plan?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Yes, but requires the approval of the scrum master.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Yes, but requires the approval of the product owner.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Yes, but the extension cannot be more than 2 days.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) No, the iterations are time-boxed.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Iteration durations are time-boxed and cannot be extended. All incomplete stories need to be returned to the product backlog where they will get re-prioritized along with the other stories in the backlog. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 25.

full-exam-2.Question: Some stakeholders in your project are not responding appropriately to your strategies for them. Due to this, you plan to investigate the reasons for this. What would be your BEST methodology for doing this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Stakeholder Prioritization
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Root Cause Analysis
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) None of the Above
full-exam-2.Explanation: A root cause analysis of the underlying reasons of stakeholder engagement levels will help work out a different strategy to improve the levels.

full-exam-2.Question: A skilled project manager should have the necessary expertise to identify appropriate project management approaches (Traditional vs. Agile) and tailor the tools, techniques, and methods for each project. These skills are called:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Strategic and Business Management Skills
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Leadership Skills
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Technical Project Management Skills
full-exam-2.Explanation: This is an example of technical project management skills. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 58.

full-exam-2.Question: You are a project manager in a manufacturing company. You want to analyze the output of a production line that manufactures piston rings. You want to determine whether the variations in the jobs are inherent to the process or if the process is in need of adjustment. Which of the following tools would be MOST useful?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Statistical Sampling
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Control Charts
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Trend Analysis
full-exam-2.Explanation: Control charts are a graphical display of the results over time of a process. They are used to determine if the process is in control or in need of adjustment. Control charts are used to determine whether or not a process is stable or has predictable performance. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 304.

full-exam-2.Question: The product owner has requested some major changes that will have a significant impact on the project and require reprioritizing the remaining backlog items. What should you do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Cancel the current sprint and immediately call a retrospective.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Complete the current iteration, reprioritize the backlog, and adapt the new plan for the next iteration.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Terminate the current sprint and reprioritize the entire project.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Complete the started stories, but do not bring any more "Ready" stories into "WIP".
full-exam-2.Explanation: Agile teams typically do not adjust their long term plan during a sprint unless all of the items being developed are dropped from the backlog. It is recommended to complete the current sprint and then re-plan and adjust accordingly. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 25.

full-exam-2.Question: During a daily stand-up meeting, one of the programmers mentions that he had some extra time and added functionality, which was not included in the original design. He believes that the customer will appreciate the added functionality. What is your best course of action?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Thank the programmer for the extra effort and notify the customer of the new functionality that has been added.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Remove the added functionality and ensure that the project team builds the software as designed.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Accept the added functionality, but ask the programmer to build only what has been designed going forward.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Update the cost baseline; since the project will run over budget due to the cost of adding new functionality.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The added software code should be removed and the project manager should ensure that the code is written as planned in the future. Removing the extra software code will reduce the overall project risk introduced with the added functionality.

full-exam-2.Question: You have recently joined an organization as the marketing manager. You have been told that a new product has just been created and you will need to get it into the market within the next month. This means press released, TV, Radio, Internet, and newspaper adverts, a big launch with at least one local celebrity. You request a meeting with a project manager for advice on initiating the project, but you are told that the organization does not have a project manager; it just has a part-time project coordinator. What is the organizational structure of the organization?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Strong Matrix
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Project-Oriented
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) PMO
full-exam-2.Explanation: Table 2-1. Organizational Structure and its influences on projects, Information Technology Project Management, page 50

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager joins a global project that will be supported by virtual teams in different time zones. How should the project manager share information in this situation?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Review the responsibility assignments matrix (RAM) to understand the virtual teams' roles.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Use the resource breakdown structure (RBS) to set up the virtual teams.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Employ project communication and technical tools to adapt to the virtual teams.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Communicate the work breakdown structure (WBS) to the virtual team members.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager will share information by employing project communication and technical tools to adapt to the virtual teams. The other options (RAM, WBS, and RBS) are not useful in this situation.

full-exam-2.Question: You are currently managing a complex project that requires a lot of knowledge work. You want some sort of visual management system that can help you visualize the flow of work, make impediments easily visible, and allow flow to be managed by adjusting the work-in-process limits. Which of the following tools can help you in this regard?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Kanban Board
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Sprint Review Meeting
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Product Backlog
full-exam-2.Explanation: A Kanban board provides a means to visualize the flow of work, make impediments easily visible, and allow flow to be managed by adjusting the work-in-process limits. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 31.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager notices that there is limited participation and contribution from a new team member. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Write a complaint to the human resources department.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Discipline the new team member.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Discuss the situation with the project sponsor.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Review the roles and responsibilities of each team member.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The project manager should FIRST (Discipline-Correction-Direction) the new team member because of his limited participation and contribution. Option (Review the roles and responsibilities of each team member) is not correct because the project manager notices that there is limited participation and contribution from a new team member only not ALL the team members. The project manager should be proactive so, option (Discuss the situation with the project sponsor) & (Write a complaint to the human resources department) are not good practices as a first step.

full-exam-2.Question: When introducing Agile methods to an organization that has historically managed all its project using predictive life cycles, which of the following approaches is more likely to succeed?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Trying the new techniques on ongoing projects.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Trying the new techniques on high-value projects.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Trying the new techniques on a less risky pilot project.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Trying the new techniques on completed projects.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Trying the new techniques on a less risky project with a medium to low degree of uncertainty is advisable. The lower the risk, the more chances of success. You need some quick wins to help smooth transition to the new approaches. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 30.

full-exam-2.Question: Two project team members have a different understanding of the intent of a work package. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Ask the team members to refer to the communication management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Empower the team members to request clarification from the client.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Review the work breakdown (WBS) dictionary with the team members.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Conduct a brainstorming session with team.
full-exam-2.Explanation: The WBS dictionary is a document that provides detailed deliverables, activity, and scheduling information about each component in the WBS. The WBS dictionary is a document that supports the WBS. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 162.

full-exam-2.Question: You have been assigned to lead an agile project. You want to ensure that project information is shared within and across the organization so that any misalignments, dependencies, or other issues related to the frequently changing requirements surfaced as quickly as possible. How could this goal be BEST achieved?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) By promoting aggressive transparency.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) By inviting stakeholders to daily standups.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) By distributing the project report weekly.
full-exam-2.Explanation: In order to accelerate the sharing of information within and across the organization, agile methods promote aggressive transparency. Inviting stakeholders to project meetings and reviews or posting project artifacts in public spaces would help surface any misalignments, dependencies, or other issues related to the frequently changing project.

full-exam-2.Question: Your software development project is in initiation. The sponsor wants to take advantage of early revenue from incremental delivery and pushes to use an agile approach. However, the team is strongly opposed to agile due to conflict among the team members. They insist on a predictive approach so they can work independently with individual task assignments. What is your BEST course of action to address these conflicts?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Recommend to lead the project using a hybrid project management approach.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Apply an agile project management approach as requested by the sponsor.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Select a predictive approach to avoid conflict among the team members.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Adopt an XP framework since it is agile, but team members work independently.
full-exam-2.Explanation: A hybrid approach would provide the opportunity for early revenue generation through incremental delivery as requested by the sponsor while allowing the project team members to work independently with individually assigned tasks.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following techniques used in adaptive lifecycles helps in minimizing scope creep?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Time-boxing
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Product Owner
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) User Stories
full-exam-2.Explanation: Time-boxed periods are durations during which the team works steadily toward completion of a goal. Time-boxing helps to minimize scope creep; as it forces the teams to process essential features first, then other features when time permits. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 182.

full-exam-2.Question: A project team is conducting sprint planning. Based on the estimated effort, only 95% of the items included in the sprint may be delivered. The product owner asks the project manager for advice on how to prioritize the backlog items. What should be used to prioritize the backlog items?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Estimation Accuracy
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Technical Complexity
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Business Value
full-exam-2.Explanation: The business value should be used to prioritize the backlog items.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following describes the characteristics of the performing stage?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) In the performing stage, the team starts to work together and adjust their behavior.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) In the performing stage, the team functions as a well-organized unit and resolves issues effectively.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) In the performing stage, the team completes the work and disbands as a project team.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) In the performing stage, the team members are not collaborative.
full-exam-2.Explanation: There are five stages of team development: Forming, Storming, Norming, Performing and Adjourning. In the Forming stage, the team members work independently. In the Storming stage, the team begins to understand the project work. In the Norming stage, the team begins to learn from one another. In the Performing stage, they work as a well-organized unit and reach maximum performance. In the Adjourning stage, the team completes the work. PMBOK Guide 6th Edition, Page 338.

full-exam-2.Question: A project manager is starting a project using a hybrid approach. The customer decided on a major change for the project design. This change was approved. The software team leader, who is supposed to develop the software, refuses to commit to delivery dates, claiming that they work using an agile approach and cannot commit to the final delivery date. The hardware team depends on this software to develop their part of the product. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Escalate this to higher management and ask for help to resolve the issue.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Update the risk register with this risk and monitor it according to the register management plan.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Impose the delivery dates on the software team leader and notify the functional manager about the situation.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Ask the software team leader to use a predictive approach and commit to the delivery date.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Hybrid approach is a combination of predictive, iterative, incremental, and/or agile. The project manager should ask the software team leader to use a predictive approach and commit to the delivery date and can follow agile to develop the hardware.

full-exam-2.Question: Your project is in the planning phase. The project team commences estimating the cost by using a work breakdown structure. What is the tool the project team uses?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Bottom-Up Estimating
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Three-Point Estimating
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Parametric Estimating
full-exam-2.Explanation: When an activity's duration cannot be estimated with a reasonable degree of confidence, the work within the activity is decomposed into more detail. Bottom-up estimating is a method of estimating project duration or cost by aggregating the estimates of the lower-level components of the WBS.

full-exam-2.Question: Teddy has been running a project. While performing a quality audit, she found that the team members have committed a number of minor mistakes while producing the product of the project. She is concerned about whether or not the project processes are under control. Which of the following tools should Teddy use to clear her doubts?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Ishikawa Diagram
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Bar Chart
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Histogram
full-exam-2.Explanation: A control chart is the best tool to use in this situation. The appropriate data is collected and analyzed to indicate the quality status of project processes and products. Control charts illustrate how a process behaves over time and when a process is subject to special cause variation, resulting in an out of control condition.

full-exam-2.Question: A lead business analyst on a large project has consistently been working late to finalize requirements for the next sprint. In the weekly team lead meeting, the project manager learns that there are several business analysts on the team free cycles. What should the project manager do to ensure an even workload?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Review the list of open requirements and reassign them to team members with free cycles.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Delay the start date of the next sprint to allow more time for gathering requirements.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Direct the business analysts with free cycles to take more ownership of the project.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Facilitate a discussion within the team to redistribute the work within the project team.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Since there are several business analysts on the team who have free cycles, the project manager should facilitate a discussion within the team to redistribute the work within the project team

full-exam-2.Question: Business people and developers must work together daily throughout the project is one of the 12 Agile principles. Which of the following Agile techniques helps achieve this?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Retrospectives
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Kanban Boards
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Backlog Preparation and Refinement
full-exam-2.Explanation: Backlog preparation and refinement are the activities where the business (product owner) and the developers (Agile team) work together to define and prioritize project objectives. The rest of the choices are tools used by Agile teams not necessarily with the direct involvement of the business. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 98.

full-exam-2.Question: An agile team has just finished an iteration in which one of the user stories is only partially complete. Which of the following is true regarding incomplete user stories?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) The project team must complete the user story with the next iteration.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Partially completed stories represent partial value for the customer.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Partially completed stories are included in velocity estimates.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Incomplete user stories are excluded from velocity estimates.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Velocity represents the rate of completion rather than the time or effort expended. Therefore, incomplete user stories are excluded from velocity estimates. Customers are only interested in receiving completed user stories and see no value in incomplete work regardless of how much of the user story was completed. For example, a partially complete product feature cannot be used to generate revenue for the customer. The incomplete user story should be returned to the product backlog at the end of the iteration. The product owner will then reprioritize the backlog and determine where to rank the incomplete user story for the next iteration.

full-exam-2.Question: A large construction project for a logistics company will require the expenditure of a large amount of capital. The finance group works with the project manager to project set limits when expenses will be incurred in a given project and to determine whether there are ways to smooth out or level the spending to avoid a single large expenditure in one quarter and none in the next. This is an example of:
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Resource Leveling
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Funding Limit Reconciliation
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Crashing
full-exam-2.Explanation: Large variations in the periodic expenditure of funds are usually undesirable for organizational operations. Therefore, the expenditure of funds is reconciled with the funding limits set by the customer or performing organization on the disbursement of funds for the project. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 253.

full-exam-2.Question: A project team has recently adopted Agile approaches to project management. However, the team is still not proficient in these methods; as it has only recently adopted these approaches. Which of the following questions should the team address to ensure it has successfully adopted an Agile Mindset?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) How can project management processes be tailored to suit each project?
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) How to ensure that all contractual obligations are fulfilled?
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) How to handle confidential information during the project?
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) How can the team deliver quickly and obtain early feedback to benefit the next delivery cycle?
full-exam-2.Explanation: Tailoring project management processes, handling confidential information, and compliance to contractual obligations are considerations of all project teams regardless of the chosen project management approach. However, Agile approaches stress on the need to deliver quickly and obtain early feedback to benefit the next delivery cycle. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 33.

full-exam-2.Question: Some of your team members seem to be not cooperating with each other. There is a lack of mutual support and they are coming to you for decision making on small issues. What can you do to make this better?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Initiate team building to increase trust among team members.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Involve them in project management work to increase their motivation.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Involve them in your decision-making activities.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Check whether there are any issues due to diverse cultures.
full-exam-2.Explanation: Increasing the trust among the team members using team building activities will improve the situation. Involving the team in project management and decision making on behalf of the project manager will not improve the teamwork. There may be teaming issues due to cultural diversity which may also be addressed by team building activities.

full-exam-2.Question: An Agile team is currently developing an inventory control system. Two programmers on the team are arguing and recommending different development approaches. One is of the view that the system should be built from scratch, while the other believes that the existing system should be enhanced and patched. How should you resolve this conflict?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Select the patch work approach; as that will save time for the organization.
full-exam-2.Choice 2: B) Develop the product from scratch; as that will bring the system closer to requirements.
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Ask the entire team to analyze both approaches and select the one that will deliver higher business value.
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Ask the product owner to choose the right approach.
full-exam-2.Explanation: This has to be a team decision. Ask the entire team to analyze both approaches and select the one that will deliver higher business value. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 4.

full-exam-2.Question: Which of the following is an example of an external failure cost?
full-exam-2.Choice 1: A) Cost of Documentation
full-exam-2.Choice 3: C) Cost of Testing
full-exam-2.Choice 4: D) Cost of Training
full-exam-2.Explanation: Warranty cost is the only cost that belongs to the category of external failure cost. Training and documentation are prevention costs. Testing is an appraisal cost. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 282.

full-exam-3.Question: During a project’s third iteration, the project manager informed the team that there is a new competitor in the market, and it is necessary to move faster to ensure that market share is not missed. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ask the team to increase the velocity to launch the product as soon as possible.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Ask the sponsor to add more people to the team.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Add the competitor’s functionalities to the product backlog to improve the product.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Help the team to find a new approach to launch the product as soon as possible.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Since it is necessary to move faster to ensure market share is not missed, the project manager should help the team to find a new approach to launch the product as soon as possible.

full-exam-3.Question: If an agile project’s earned value is $100.000 and the CPI is 0.8, how much the team has spent so far on the project?
full-exam-3.Explanation: Since CPI=earned value/actual costs, this means that actual costs = earned value/CPI=$100.000/0.8=$125.000. This means that the team has spent more on the project than planned. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 69.

full-exam-3.Question: One of your project team members does not finish his tasks on time. As a project manager, what should you do next?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Conduct one-on-one meeting with the team member.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Release a team member.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Have a meeting with the project team members and evaluate the impact on the project.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Schedule training sessions for the team member to optimize his performance.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The first step is to conduct a one-to-one meeting with the team member to understand why why he does not finish his tasks on time.

full-exam-3.Question: An agile team wants to use a quick method using relative size to estimate the user stories. Which metric would you recommend to the team?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Velocity
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Real Time
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Lead Time
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Story Points
full-exam-3.Explanation: A story point is an arbitrary unite measure used to determine the relative size of a user story compared to the other user stories in the backlog. It is also a measure of the effort required to implement a story. In simple terms, a story point defines how hard the story will be to develop. Story point values could be related to complexity, the number of unknowns, or the effort required to complete a task. A story point value is defined as a range of relative values.

full-exam-3.Question: You are a project manager and having a dispute with your seller over certain changes. You have met him to discuss the dispute, but you did not reach an agreement by negotiation. What should be the BEST way to resolve this?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Involve your sponsor to settle this claim.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Renegotiate if possible.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR)
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Litigation
full-exam-3.Explanation: If the parties themselves do not resolve a claim, it may have to be handled in accordance with alternative dispute resolution (ADR) typically following procedures established in the contract. Settlement of all claims and disputes through negotiation is the preferred method. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Pages 478&479.

full-exam-3.Question: You are using a methodology that calculates the amount of float on various paths in the network diagram to determine the minimum project duration. What tool or technique are you using?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Three-point Estimating
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Critical Path Method
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Parametric Estimating
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Critical Chain Method
full-exam-3.Explanation: The critical path method is used to estimate the minimum project duration and determine the amount of schedule flexibility on the logical network paths within the schedule model. A critical path is normally characterized by zero total floats on the critical path.

full-exam-3.Question: You are assigned as a project manager to a project in the execution stage. The current schedule and performance indices for the project, SPI and CPI are 1.12 and 1.15, and project performance is well within the baseline. The defects found during internal testing for the last deliverable were well below the organization's limits. However, the customer does not seem to be happy with the project progress. What should be the FIRST thing you should do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Improve project schedule and cost control measure so that SPI and CPI reache above 1.5.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Conduct a meeting with the customer to understand his concern over project progress.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Meet with the project team to understand open issues in the project.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Start managing project as you gain more insight into day to day responsibilities.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The most important thing for the project manager who is taking over the project midway is to understand why the customer is unhappy in spite of the project performance being well within the baseline. Option (Start managing project as you gain more insight into day-to-day responsibilities) would not address the main problem. Option (Improve project schedule and cost control measure so that SPI and CPI reaches above 1.5) has no valid justification. Option (Meet with the project team to understand open issues in the project) could be a good option after talking to the customer to address his concerns and other issue on the project.

full-exam-3.Question: After contract sign-off, a project manager learns that the vendor has a reputation of not delivering according to the contract. To ensure the vendor’s compliance, what should the project manager do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Conduct a make-or-buy analysis to verify vendor reliability.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Cancel the current contract and select another vendor.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Insist on a firm fixed price contract (FFP) with the vendor.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Perform periodic inspection of the vendor’s work and progress.
full-exam-3.Explanation: To ensure the vendor’s compliance, the project manager should perform periodic inspection of the vendor’s work and progress to take corrective action as per the contract at the right time.

full-exam-3.Question: You are a project manager for a project. One of the subject matter experts (SMEs) who is working in your project identifies an occurrence and asks you to include it in the lessons learned register. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Request the SME to wait until the project closure phase.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Take ownership of documenting this information.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Ask the SME to document and capture the occurrence.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Assign the documenting task to project team members.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project manager should assign the documenting task to project team members.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager wants to measure velocity as the indicator of the agile team's progress. Which of the following metrics is BEST for the project manager to use for this purpose?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) The number of iterations completed by the team per release.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) The number of user story points completed by the team per iteration.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) The number of user story points completed by the team per day.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) The number of story points planned to be completed in the next iteration.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Velocity is typically calculated as the sum of story points sizes for the features actually completed during an iteration. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Pages 61, 64.

full-exam-3.Question: Robert is managing an airport construction project. He is currently assessing stakeholder aspects like their interests, rights, ownership, knowledge, and contributions. What will be his preference of technique to work this out?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Root Cause Analysis
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Stakeholder Engagement Plan
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Stakeholder Analysis
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Stakeholder Mapping using Salience Model
full-exam-3.Explanation: Stakeholder analysis results in a list of stakeholders and relevant information such as their positions in the organization, roles on the project, “stakes”, expectations, attitudes (their levels of support for the project), and their interest in information about the project. Stakeholders’ stakes can include but are not limited to a combination of interest, rights, contribution and ownership.

full-exam-3.Question: Your project team works in two different buildings across the city. The team has been struggling to perform effectively; morale is low and has a difficult time resolving problems. What would be the BEST team development technique to resolve this issue?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Rewards
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Training
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Mediation
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Co-location
full-exam-3.Explanation: Co-location involves placing many or all of the most active project team members in the same physical location to enhance their ability to perform as a team. Co-location strategies can include a team meeting room, common places to post schedules, and other conveniences that enhance communication and sense of community.

full-exam-3.Question: You are a project manager working in a multinational company. You have been just been assigned to initiate a project in a new country where your company has no presence. To develop an appropriate implementation strategy, what should be considered FIRST?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Identify and monitor the risks because your company does not have lessons-learned for this country.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Evaluate the environmental and regulatory factors and identify high-level risks and assumptions.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Assign project resources from the new country to mitigate the risk.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Ask the sponsor to work on another project.
full-exam-3.Explanation: When you are assigned to start a project in a new country, you must take into consideration the environmental and regulatory factors and identify high-level risks and assumptions to develop an appropriate implementation strategy.

full-exam-3.Question: An agile team is developing a product for a customer. In the last few iterations, the team members spent extra hours creating product documentation and reviewing the contracts with the customer. How would the team's time be better spent?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Building features according to the initial project management plan
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Developing functionality as requested by the project sponsor
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Reporting the extra hours in the company's time and attendance tools
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Creating the product increment and working with the product owner
full-exam-3.Explanation: Creating the product increment and working with the product owner is the best answer among the choices given; as it represents value to the customer and is aligned with the agile manifesto values of creating working software and collaborating with the customer (or with the product owner who is the voice of the customer).

full-exam-3.Question: During the sprint planning meeting, the amount of work necessary for fulfilling the items requested by the product owner seems greater than the development team's capacity. Which action makes more sense?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Increase the number of sprints.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) The development team and product owner collaborate with a view to removing or modifying items.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) The product owner demands that the development team work overtime just for this sprint, provided that this does not happen again.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Cancel the sprint.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The development team and product owner collaborate, with a view to removing or modifying items.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager is assigned to a project in a company that is transitioning from a traditional approach to agile. The relevant organizational personnel lacks experience with agile methodologies. The organization has elected to use hybrid life cycles as a transition strategy. What else should be done to facilitate the transition?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Contract an external agile coach to assist the organization with the transition.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Establish a directive project management office (PMO) to lead the transition.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Replace the existing project manager with an experienced external agile coach.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Eliminate the project manager's role entirely; as agile teams are self-managing.
full-exam-3.Explanation: An external agile coach can bring significant experience on agile best practices to assist the project team with the transition until internal resources are able to take over the responsibility.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager suggests implementing a new system using a mix of scrum and Kanban methodologies. The product owner is confused as to how to start delivering the functionalities required. How should the project manager assist the product owner?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Coach the team to decompose the project task.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Discuss the product owner’s responsibilities within the project team.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Explain the deliverables to the product owner.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Coach the product owner on how to create a product backlog.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Coach the product owner on how to create a product backlog.

full-exam-3.Question: The project manager is trying to get sign off for a series of marketing materials. The work is rejected by the stakeholders responsible for sign off because of incorrect use of marketing standards. What should the project manager do before sending materials to the stakeholders again?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Validate scope before communicating the project status.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Create a work breakdown structure before validating the scope.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Validate the scope before performing quality control.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Perform quality control checks before validating the scope.
full-exam-3.Explanation: In the scenario, the work is being validated by the stakeholders, but there are quality concerns noted by the incorrect use of standards. Ideally, the control quality process should be completed before the scope can be validated. It is unclear from the scenario whether or not this process has been carried out at all. Regardless, now when the issues have been found during scope validation, it is essential that before repeating the validate scope process for this work, the project manager and the project team conduct the control quality process to ensure correctness and proper adherence to the marketing quality standards. Then the scope can be validated based on both correctness and completeness.

full-exam-3.Question: You are the project manager of a large project for your organization. You have recently reported that the project’s SPI is 0.85 and the CPI is 1.17. You want to focus that the project is under control in the next project status review. How should you report the project status to key stakeholders?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Report that the project is not tracking as expected, but is still under control.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Prepare a detailed presentation for stakeholders on earned value, including how it is calculated.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Report that the project is behind schedule, but that an additional experienced resource can be added to stay within schedule and maintain the budget.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Use Pareto chart and why-why diagram to demonstrate that the project is under control.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project's SPI is 0.85 and the CPI is 1.17. Therefore, the project is behind schedule and under budget. The project manager should report that the project is behind schedule, but that an additional experienced resource can be added to stay within schedule an maintain the budget.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager is managing a project with a newly formed project team. An experienced team member is complaining about the complexity of the tasks and is not happy with the project team. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Update the risk register with potential schedule delays.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Ask the team member to find a solution to overcome the challenges as the tasks are unavoidable.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Set up team building activities with the project team members to reduce tension.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Actively listen to the team member and identify ways to support their needs in completing the task.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The best course action is to set up team building activities with the project team members to reduce tension and enhance relations between team members.

full-exam-3.Question: Two team members on your project often disagree. You need a conflict resolution method that provides a long-term resolution. Which of the following approaches do you decide to use?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Smoothing
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Compromise
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Withdrawal
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Problem Solving
full-exam-3.Explanation: Problem Solving provides a long-term resolution. Collaborate/problem solve, incorporating multiple viewpoints and insights from different perspectives; requires a cooperative attitude and open dialogue that typically leads to consensus and commitment. This approach can result in a win-win situation. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 349.

full-exam-3.Question: As part of earned value management (EVM), the budget at completion (BAC) for the project is $100.000 and the estimate at completion (EAC) is $120.000. If the schedule performance index (SPI) is equal to 1.0, what is the cost performance index (CPI)?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Less than 1.0
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Greater than 1.0
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Equal to 1.0
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Equal to 1.2
full-exam-3.Explanation: EAC=BAC/CPI so, CPI= 100.000.000/120.000.000= 0.83. Therefore, the CPI is less than 1.0.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager is approached by the sponsor who requests to provide an estimate as to how long will it take for the agile development team to complete the project. How should the project manager respond?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Project duration will be determined using bottom-up estimating by adding up the duration of the tasks comprising the user stories in the product backlog.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) The velocity of the project team will be calculated prior to the start of the first iteration and then multiplied by the number of iterations in the project.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Once the velocity is established, the total amount of story points divided by the velocity of the project team will determine the project duration.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) The project duration will be determined by adding the total number of story points completed by the development team members in each iteration.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Velocity is usually known after the team has run a few iterations (typically two to three). Dividing the total amount of story points by velocity would result in the number of iterations required to complete the project. With a time-boxed iteration length (for example, 2 weeks), the estimated project duration can then be calculated.

full-exam-3.Question: By the project management information system (PMIS), a project management team is updating a dashboard monthly with information on the project's performance. Which of the following communication methods describes this?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Interactive Communication
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Manual Communication
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Informal Communication
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Pull Communication
full-exam-3.Explanation: The dashboard is updated monthly with information on the project's performance to help the internal and external stakeholders to get the information any time by using the PMIS. It is an example of pull communication. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 374.

full-exam-3.Question: During the initiation phase, the project manager is classifying a list of project stakeholders and discovers an interested stakeholder with little authority. How should he manage this stakeholder?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Keep satisfied.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Manage closely.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Monitor.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Keep informed.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The stakeholder is interested in the project with little authority so, you will keep him informed.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager wants to recruit another team member to replace an architect who resigned. What document should capture this change?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ground Rules
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Organizational Process Assets
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Project Management Plan
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Responsibility Assignments Matrix (RAM)
full-exam-3.Explanation: RAMs are used within the group to designate roles, responsibilities, and levels of authority for specific activities. The matrix format shows all activities associated with one activity. This also ensures that there is only one person accountable for any one task to avoid confusion about who is ultimately in charge or has authority for the work. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 317.

full-exam-3.Question: You find some difference or variance between the funds available and the planned expenditures over the duration of the project, with the latter being higher than the former for certain time periods. What must be done first to address this issue?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Reschedule certain activities if possible so that the rate of expenditures can be levelled to the available funding.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Transfer funds from other time periods to the periods where the planned expenditures are higher.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Use a portion of the risk budget to provide this extra funding; as there is a risk of not completing the activities for that time period due to lack of funds.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Use a portion of the change budget to provide this extra funding; as there is a difference between the plan and fund available.
full-exam-3.Explanation: This approach is called funding limit reconciliation. The expenditure of funds should be reconciled with any funding limits on the commitment of funds for the project. A variance between the funding limits and the planned expenditures will sometimes necessitate the rescheduling of work to level out the art of expenditures. This is accomplished by placing imposed date constraints for work into the project schedule. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 253.

full-exam-3.Question: Your team member wants to make technical changes to an activity, which will add more time to that activity. What should you do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Check if the activity is on critical path.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Ignore change in activities.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Report to senior management.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Allow team members to change the activity.
full-exam-3.Explanation: It is the probability that the activity has a float so, ‘’check if the activity is on the critical path’’ is the best option.

full-exam-3.Question: Midway through project execution, several stakeholders raised concerns about team performance and delivery. The project manager believes that the project is progressing as per the approved scope, budget, and schedule. What should the project manager do next?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ask stakeholders to escalate their concerns to the CEO.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Email the stakeholders to assure them of action.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Ask the project sponsor to interview.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Consult the communications management plan to manage stakeholders' expectations.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The stakeholders raise concerns about team performance and the project manager believes the project is progressing as per the approved scope, budget, and schedule. Therefore, the project manager should consult the communications management plan to manage stakeholders' expectations.

full-exam-3.Question: In the develop schedule process, ـــــــــــــ technique is used to provide a high-level summary timeline of the 3-6 months schedule based on the product road map and the product vision for the product evaluation.
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Root Cause Analysis
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Project Management Information System
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Data Analysis
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Agile Release Planning
full-exam-3.Explanation: Agile release planning is used in the develop schedule process to provide a high-level summary timeline of the release schedule (3-6) months based on the product roadmap and the product vision for the product evaluation. It also determines the number of iterations or sprints in the release. It also allows the product owner and team to decide how much it needs to be developed and how much it will take to have a releasable product.

full-exam-3.Question: When should the project manager plan for risk identification activities?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ongoing throughout the project.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) During the perform quantitative risk analysis process.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) During the perform qualitative risk analysis process.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) During the plan risk management process.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Identify risks is the process of determining what risks can affect the project. Many different stakeholders usually participate in the identify risks process. The process of identify risks is iterative because unknown risks can be discovered throughout the life cycle of the project. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 409.

full-exam-3.Question: In the final meeting to approve these deliverables that are completed in a project, some stakeholders state that the product does not meet their needs. What should the project manager do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Validate that the deliverables are as requested and close the project.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Demonstrate that the objectives in the project charter have been achieved.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Review the list of stakeholders and determine whether the appropriate individuals attended the meeting.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Demonstrate that the deliverables have been verified and negotiate their approval.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project charter includes the project objectives, the approval requirements, high-level requirements, project exit criteria (what are the conditions to be met in order to close or cancel the project or phase), and project purpose. Therefore, the project manager should demonstrate that the objectives in the project charter have been achieved. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 124.

full-exam-3.Question: You are working on a project that is part of a program. All the projects within this program are being managed in an agile way. What is a good technique to get the project teams aligned?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Conduct a scrum of scrums.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Hold one daily standup meeting for all the projects.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Develop one project management plan.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Assign one customer point of contact for all projects.
full-exam-3.Explanation: scrum of scrums (SoS), also known as ‘’meta scrum,’’ is a technique used when two or more scrum teams consisting of three to nine members each need to coordinate their work instead of one large scrum team. A representative from each team attends a meeting with the other team representative(s), potentially daily but typically two or three times a week. The daily meeting is conducted similar to the daily standup in scrum where the representative reports completed work, next set of work, any current impediments, and potential upcoming impediments that might block the other team(s). The goal is to ensure the teams are coordinating work and removing impediments to optimize the efficiency of all the teams. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 111.

full-exam-3.Question: During a project’s third iteration, a planned activity becomes more complex. The work should be delivered in the shortest time possible. What approach should be used in the situation?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) The team should request support from external members.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) The team member brings SMEs to help them.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) The cross-functional team members work together to complete the activity.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) The product owner should remove the complex activities from the product backlog.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The cross-functional teams consist of team members with all the skills necessary to produce a working product. In software development, cross-functional teams are typically comprised of designers, developers, testers, and any other required roles. The cross-functional development teams consist of professional who deliver potentially releasable product on regular cadence. Cross-functional teams are critical because they can deliver finished work in the shortest possible time, with higher quality, and without external dependencies.

full-exam-3.Question: Which of the following main events are defined by the scrum framework?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting, Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily Kanban Meeting
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting, Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily Scrum Meeting.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting, Sprint Review Meeting, and Mid-Sprint Status Review Meeting
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting, Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily XP Meeting
full-exam-3.Explanation: The main events defined by the scrum framework: Sprint Planning Meeting, Sprint Retrospective Meeting, Sprint Review Meeting, and Daily Scrum Meeting. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 101.

full-exam-3.Question: ـــــــــــــــــ can be defined as a technique to operate scrum at scale for multiple teams working on the same product, coordinating discussions of progress on their inter-dependencies, and focusing on how to integrate the delivery of software, especially in areas of overlap.
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Large Scale Scrum (LeSS)
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Unified Scrum
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Scrum
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Scrum of Scrums
full-exam-3.Explanation: Scrum of scrums: A technique to operate scrum at scale for multiple teams working on the same product, coordinating discussions of progress on their inter-dependencies, and focusing on how to integrate the delivery of software, especially in areas of overlap. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 154.

full-exam-3.Question: You are a project manager of a new digital solution project. You have created all the necessary plans and activities to ensure a successful integration and solutions launch. There is a risk of a partner's system being unavailable which could impact the project negatively. What key activity is needed to ensure the project's success?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Continuously monitor the risk of the partner system's unavailability and put the proper solution place in case the risk materializes into an actual issue.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Mitigate the risk by developing alternative plans to make the solution ready and available without full integration capabilities.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Communicate to the project stakeholders that full integration may not be possible and that the project will potentially be delayed as a result.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Eliminate the risk by mandating the partner to change the system settings to facilitate easier integration with the new solution.
full-exam-3.Explanation: A key activity that is needed to ensure the project's success is continuously monitoring the risk of the partner system's unavailability and put the proper solution plans in place in case the risk materializes into an actual issue.

full-exam-3.Question: An error detected in the engineering drawing and results in significant rework and cost overruns. The project manager performs a root cause analysis and discovers that the drawing was not checked according to procedures. What should the project manager do to ensure that this does not happen in future projects?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Inform all other project managers.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Update the quality management plan.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Identify and control the resource responsible for mistakes.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Capture the findings in the lessons learned repository.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project manager should capture the findings in the lessons learned repository to ensure that this does not happen in the future projects

full-exam-3.Question: The project sponsor in an agile project informed the project lead that an executive would like an update on the project’s progress. What should the project lead to?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Reach out to the project management office PMO for status report templates and provide project updates in that format.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Invite the executive to the project’s meeting space to determine if the project information radiators meet their needs.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Provide a link to the project’s shared drive for the executive to search through for any artifacts that are of interest.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Ask the project sponsor or product owner to provide an update; since the project lead should be trying to keep the team free from impediments.
full-exam-3.Explanation: An information radiator is a comprehensive display of key team information, openly shared with all team members and other stakeholders and continuously updated. It includes information such as the Kanban or task board, the team velocity, continuous integration status, the progress of the team, and Sprint Burndown charts (when on walls). The project lead/scrum master should invite the executive to the project’s meeting space to determine if the project information radiators meet their needs.

full-exam-3.Question: As a project manager, many of your project team members are new to the project, and while they are working well as a team, you are concerned as to whether they are following the procedures correctly. What tool or technique is likely to help you determine if there is a problem?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ishikawa Diagram
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Inspection
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Histogram
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Quality Audit
full-exam-3.Explanation: A quality audit is a tool used in the manage quality process to determine if the project activities are following organizational and project policies, processes, and procedures. Since the team members are new to the project, a quality audit could identify compliance with the procedures as well as proactively offer assistance to improve implementation of procedures. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Pages 294&295.

full-exam-3.Question: A project management team has identified a large number of sellers who seem capable to be taken as contractors into the project supply network and allocated to work items. What should be the next step for the team?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Sign contracts with the sellers.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Develop a short list of qualified sellers.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Conduct a technical evaluation of proposals.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Invite the seller to contract negotiations.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Develop a short list of qualified sellers. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 468.

full-exam-3.Question: A stakeholder who was incorrectly classified as a supporter is now reluctant and the project manager becomes worried. What should the project manager do more carefully in future projects?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Create the stakeholders engagement assessment matrix.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Conduct a meeting with senior management.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Develop interpersonal skills to manage stakeholder expectations.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Identify stakeholders.
full-exam-3.Explanation: A stakeholder engagement assessment matrix supports the comparison between the current engagement levels of stakeholders and the desired engagement levels required for successful project delivery. The stakeholder engagement assessment matrix, shown in figure 13-6, displays gaps between current and desired engagement levels of individual stakeholders. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 521.

full-exam-3.Question: Unlike traditional managers, agile leaders:
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Handle uncertainties, risks, and changes.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Create working agreements.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Solve problems for the team.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Enable team members to act.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Agile project management approach emphasizes servant leadership as a way to empower teams. Unlike traditional managers, agile leaders encourage their teams to be self-organizing, self-directing, and empowered to make their own decisions. In other words, agile leaders enable their team members to act upon decisions the teams are making. Managers in an agile environment practice servant leadership by supporting and encouraging others in their endeavors so that they can perform at their highest level and continue to improve.

full-exam-3.Question: A project team, that is experienced in the waterfall project management approach, has been assigned to their transition easier. It has been decided to keep some elements of the waterfall approach in place. During the iteration review, it was realized that a misunderstanding among the development team has led to a duplication of efforts. How might the project manager address this issue?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Do nothing; since the team members are transitioning from waterfall to agile.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Fallback to a waterfall project management framework going forward.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Submit a change request to update the communications management plan.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Bring up the topic during the upcoming iteration retrospective.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Regularly scheduled retrospectives can be used in any project, predictive, agile, or hybrid. Retrospective provides the project team an opportunity to learn from its previous work, investigate issues, and improve and adapt their processes.

full-exam-3.Question: During daily meetings, a team member continues to express issues in completing his task. As a project manager, what should you do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Have a confidential discussion with the team member to identify the root cause.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Start a discussion with all team members to help resolve the issue.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Move the team member to another task that is more skill appropriate.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Wait for the team to identify and solve the problem independently.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project manager should intervene and meet with the team member to find out the root cause of the problem instead of waiting and affecting the project and the rest of the team members. Therefore, the project manager should have a confidential discussion with the team member to identify the root cause.

full-exam-3.Question: An organization has historically executed most projects using a predictive approach. The organization now wants to change over to an agile approach. Due to this change, the project manager is worried about the scope definition process for upcoming projects. What should the project manager do to ensure that the project scope is completely defined?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Meet with the general manager and convince them to return to use the predictive approach to avoid any risk.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Ask the general manager to review every requirement to ensure that all projects will deliver the required products.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Ask the sponsor to increase a budget to check if every business needs are included in the requirements.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Help sponsors and stakeholders craft the product vision and bring the team and product owner together to clarify the expectations.
full-exam-3.Explanation: To define the scope in an agile approach, the project manager should help sponsors and stakeholders craft the product vision and bring the team and product owner together to clarify the expectations.

full-exam-3.Question: During the implementation phase, you want to compare the baseline to the actual results and determine if the variance is within the threshold amount or if corrective or preventive action is appropriate. Which of the following techniques can help you?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Trend Analysis
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Control Chart
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Decomposition
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Variance Analysis
full-exam-3.Explanation: Variance analysis is used to compare the baseline to the actual results and determine if the variance is within the threshold amount if corrective or preventive action is appropriate. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 170.

full-exam-3.Question: You are managing a construction project. Your cost performance is not as planned and your project is over budget. Therefore, you again estimate the cost of the project and find that you will require more money to complete the project. This will require an update of the cost baseline. What will you do?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Update change log.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Issue the change request.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Update the cost baseline.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Terminate the project.
full-exam-3.Explanation: If there is a change which requires an update to the cost baseline, you will raise it, get it approved, and then update the cost baseline. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Pages 113&115.

full-exam-3.Question: The marketing team is transferring to using hybrid approaches for their projects. The marketing director is not knowledgeable about hybrid methodologies and the project manager needs the director’s support; as the marketing director is a key stakeholder. What should the project manager do to obtain the support?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Ask the marketing director to participate in daily meetings.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Train the marketing team and keep the director informed.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Ask the marketing team members to coach the director.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Mentor the marketing director on hybrid approaches.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The project manager should mentor the marketing director on hybrid approaches; as the marketing director is a key stakeholder and should be managed closely.

full-exam-3.Question: During the halfway of an iteration, one of the stakeholders wants to delay the completion date of the iteration so that the features that he requested can be completed. How should the team respond?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Delay the iteration completion date.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Bring additional developers on the team for this iteration only.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Continue working at their sustainable pace and not extend the iteration.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Work extra hours on the project.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The team operates within a fixed iteration length and should not extend it. The team should also maintain a sustainable pace. Agile Practice Guide, 1st Edition, Page 9.

full-exam-3.Question: While adjusting the critical path, you find that extending the project end date is inevitable due to the short supply of a few people. What else can you do to prevent or reduce this project delay?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Negotiate revised project end date with the customer.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Add floats to few of the critical path tasks.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Crash the critical path.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Fast-track the project.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Fast-tracking, if possible, seems to be the best option; as crashing is not possible due to people shortage. The float cannot be added to critical path tasks else it is no longer a critical path.

full-exam-3.Question: A project manager finds that a specific work package was not delivered on time and will be delayed by an additional 3 weeks. The project manager worries that this might impact project completion. What should the project manager do first?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Calculate the amount of free float for the work package.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Determine if the work package is on the critical path.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Adjust the Gantt chart for the work package.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Use schedule compression to get the project back on track.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The work package will be delayed by an additional three weeks and may have a float of 4 weeks or more so, the project manager should FIRST determine if the work package is on the critical path.

full-exam-3.Question: A project to develop a new retail banking product is in progress. The project has fallen behind schedule because team members are lacking motivation. What should the project manager do to motivate the project team?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Offer Recognition and Rewards.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Apply Creative problem solving.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Use coaching and monitoring skills.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Delegate the responsibilities.
full-exam-3.Explanation: The team members are lacking motivation so, the best thing the project manager should do to motivate them is to offer recognition and rewards. People are motivated when they feel they are valued in the organization and this value is demonstrated by the rewards given to them. Generally, money viewed as a tangible aspect of any reward system, but intangible rewards could be equally or even more effective. Most project team members are motivated by opportunity to grow, accomplish, be appreciated, and apply their professional skills to meet new challenges. A good strategy for project managers is to give the team recognition throughout the life cycle of the project rather than waiting until the project is completed. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 342.

full-exam-3.Question: A stakeholder requests the scrum master to show him the latest weekly status report to check the project's health and the remining amount of work in the project. Instead, he takes the stakeholder to the team wall where a few pertinent updates are posted continuously. To address the stakeholder's query, the scrum master points out to:
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Burndown Chart
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Velocity Trend
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Sprint Backlog
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Kanban Board
full-exam-3.Explanation: A burndown chart shows the amount of work that has been completed in a sprint and the total work remaining.

full-exam-3.Question: You are the project manager of a large IT project. Your agile team wants to develop quality standards for a project. How should you coach the team?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Determine the tools and techniques suitable for the project and ensuring that testing is done early and continuously.
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Ensure that the definition of done DOD is provided when the product owner agrees that all acceptance criteria have been met for the user story.
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Insist that test-driven development is implemented along with automated testing.
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Inform the team that user acceptance testing is required to ensure that the product owner accepts the solution.
full-exam-3.Explanation: Definition of done is a team's checklist of all the criteria required to be met so that a deliverable can be considered ready for customer use. If the team wants to develop quality standards, the project manager should ensure that the definition of done DOD is provides when the product owner agrees that all acceptance criteria have been met for the user story.

full-exam-3.Question: An agile team is tasked with the development of a robot. The project manager wants to ensure that before the actual robot is built, the team receives early feedback on requirements and adapts the design accordingly. Which of the following should the project manager use to achieve that goal?
full-exam-3.Choice 1: A) Prototyping
full-exam-3.Choice 2: B) Checklists
full-exam-3.Choice 3: C) Design Review
full-exam-3.Choice 4: D) Business Case
full-exam-3.Explanation: Prototyping supports the concept of progressive elaboration in iterative cycles, such as those used in agile projects described in the scenario. When enough feedback cycles have been performed, the requirements obtained from the prototype are sufficiently complete to move to the design or build phase. PMBOK Guide, 6th Edition, Page 147.
